Pasient spør: "Hjelper glukosamin?"
Forskningen viser liten til ingen effekt utover placebo for de fleste. Pengene brukes bedre på trening og fysioterapi.

Du er en medisinsk sikkerhetsrådgiver for kiropraktikk. Identifiser røde flagg, gi differensialdiagnostikk og klinisk resonnering. Prioriter alltid pasientsikkerhet. Klassifiser hastegrad: AKUTT (ring 113), HENVIS SAMME DAG, HENVIS RUTINE, MONITORÉR, eller TRYGT.
Vurder røde flagg: 80 år mann. Ensidig tinningshodepine med plutselig komplett synstap på høyre øye for 2 timer siden. SR 110. Palpasjonsøm temporalarterie.

AKUTT: Temporalisarteritt med akutt permanernt synstap (anterior iskemisk optikusnevropati). Synstapet kan bli bilateralt uten behandling. Ring 113 / akutt sykehus. Iv metylprednisolon 1g i 3 dager, deretter oral prednisolon. Akutt øyelegevurdering. Biopsi innen 14 dager.
You are a clinical documentation assistant for chiropractors. Generate professional medical documentation.
Describe When Should You Seek Help? for TMD and IBS: The Surprising Connection Between Jaw and Gut.

When Should You Seek Help?

 

 Seek help if:

 
 You have persistent symptoms from both jaw and gut

 Stress worsens both conditions

 Symptoms affect quality of life

 You've tried self-help without adequate effect

 

 
 Red Flags - Contact a Doctor

 
 Unexplained weight loss

 Blood in stool

 Nighttime symptoms that wake you

 Symptom onset after age 50

 Fever together with abdominal pain

 
 These may indicate other conditions that need to be ruled out.

 

 Multidisciplinary Collaboration

 For overlapping conditions, multiple professionals can contribute:

 
 Chiropractor: Jaw treatment and holistic assessment

 GP: Evaluation and coordination

 Gastroenterologist: For severe or unclear IBS

 Psychologist: Cognitive therapy for stress management

 Dietitian: Diet optimization

Pasient spør: "Hvilke muskler gir oftest hodepine?"

De vanligste musklene er suboccipitale muskler (nakkeroten), Øvre trapezius, SCM (halsmuskel), temporalis (tinning), masseter (tyggmuskelen) og splenius capitis. Hver muskel har sitt karakteristiske smertemønster.

Du er en rask klinisk tekstassistent. Generer korte, presise kliniske oppsummeringer for kiropraktisk dokumentasjon.
Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Hodepine Etter Nakkesleng.

Hva er post-traumatisk hodepine etter nakkesleng?: I Nord-Sverige rapporteres det årlig ca. 235 nakkeslengskader per 100 000 innbyggere (Styrke et al., Spine 2012).

Hvorfor får man hodepine etter nakkesleng?: Studier med diagnostiske blokader viser at fasettleddene i nakken er hovedkilden til smerter hos flertallet med kronisk nakkesleng (Lord & Barnsley, Spine 1996). De hyppigst affiserte nivåene er C2-C3 (36%) og C5-C6 (35%).

Symptomer: Post-traumatisk hodepine har ofte en blanding av flere hodepinetyper
Diagnostikk: Ved nakkesleng starter vi alltid med en grundig klinisk undersøkelse. Vi undersøker nakkebevegelighet, leddenes funksjon, muskulatur og nevrologisk status. Canadian C-Spine Rule brukes for å vurdere om bildediagnostikk er nødvendig.

Behandling: En Cochrane-oversikt fra 2007 gjennomgikk 23 studier med over 2300 deltakere. Hovedkonklusjonen var tydelig: Tidlig aktiv mobilisering er klart bedre enn hvile og nakkekrage.

Røde flagg - Når du bør søke lege umiddelbart: Les mer om røde flagg ved nakkesmerter

Prognose - Hvordan går det?: Forskning viser at bedring hovedsakelig skjer i løpet av de første 3 månedene etter skaden. Etter dette flater bedringskurven dramatisk ut. En studie fant at 86% av de som fortsatt var symptomatiske ved 3 måneder, forble symptomatiske etter 2 år.
You are a quick clinical text assistant. Generate concise clinical summaries for chiropractic documentation.
Clinical summary of Chronic Whiplash: Long.

Key takeaways

 Approximately 50% of whiplash patients develop chronic symptoms lasting beyond 3 months (Physiopedia; Frontiers, 2022)

 Central sensitisation explains why pain persists without visible damage on MRI -- the pain is real

 Multidisciplinary treatment with manual therapy, graded exercise and pain education produces the best results

 Chronic does not mean permanent: Most people achieve significant improvement with the right approach

 4,000-5,000 whiplash injuries are reported annually in Norway

Prikking, nummenhet og "sovende" fingre er plager mange kjenner seg igjen i. Når symptomene dukker opp, tenker de fleste først på karpaltunnelsyndrom - men i overraskende mange tilfeller kommer plagene faktisk fra nakken.

 Viktig å vite: En grundig undersøkelse er avgjørende for å finne riktig behandling, da symptomene kan være nærmest identiske.

Forklar prognose for Pes Anserine Bursitt.

Prognose

 Prognosen for pes anserine bursitt er generelt god
 Forventet forløp

 Akutte tilfeller: Bedring ofte innen 3-4 uker med riktig behandling

 Kroniske tilfeller: Kan ta 6-12 uker for full bedring

 Med kortikosteroidinjeksjon: Rask lindring, men bør kombineres med rehabilitering

 Hva sier forskningen?

 Studier viser at kombinasjonen av toying, styrketrening og kortikosteroidinjeksjon gir bedre langtidsresultater enn injeksjon alene. Rehabilitering er nødvendig for varig bedring.

 Tilbakefallsrisiko

 Tilbakefall er vanlig hvis underliggende faktorer ikke adresseres
 Vedvarende stramme hamstrings

 Ubehandlet artrose

 For rask retur til belastende aktiviteter

 Overvekt

You are a quick clinical text assistant. Generate concise clinical summaries for chiropractic documentation.
Provide a structured clinical overview of Piriformis Syndrome.

What is Piriformis Syndrome?: Piriformis syndrome occurs when the piriformis muscle - a small, pear-shaped muscle deep in the buttock region - irritates or compresses the sciatic nerve. The result is pain radiating down the back of the thigh, often confused with "true" sciatica from a herniated disc in the lower back.

Causes and Risk Factors: Piriformis syndrome is divided into primary (congenital anatomical cause) and secondary (acquired) types. The secondary type accounts for over 85% of cases .

Symptoms: Piriformis syndrome produces a characteristic symptom pattern that differs from discogenic sciatica. Four cardinal symptoms have been identified (Hopayian & Danielyan, 2018)
Diagnosis: There is no single test that confirms piriformis syndrome with certainty. The diagnosis is made clinically through medical history, physical examination, and exclusion of other causes.

Treatment: Conservative treatment is the first choice for piriformis syndrome. Studies show that 79-85% of patients achieve good improvement with manual treatment combined with exercises (Benson & Schutzer, 1999; Fishman et al., 2002).

Red Flags - When to See a Doctor: These may be signs of cauda equina syndrome requiring emergency treatment.

Prognosis: The vast majority with piriformis syndrome improve significantly with conservative treatment. A study on patients with normal imaging showed that 98% (41 of 42) recovered within 35 days (Vassalou et al., 2018).

Frequently Asked Questions: Yes, absolutely. Piriformis syndrome is often called "false sciatica" because the symptoms are very similar. The main difference is that true sciatica from herniation often radiates all the way to the foot and worsens with coughing/sneezing, while piriformis syndrome typically stops above the knee and worsens most with sitting.

Beskriv Hvorfor får man hodepine etter nakkesleng? for Hodepine Etter Nakkesleng - Whiplash og Hodepine.

Hvorfor får man hodepine etter nakkesleng?

 

 Vanligste Årsaker - fra mest til minst vanlig

 
 1. Fasettleddskader (ca. 60% av kroniske tilfeller)

 Studier med diagnostiske blokader viser at fasettleddene i nakken er hovedkilden til smerter hos flertallet med kronisk nakkesleng (Lord & Barnsley, Spine 1996). De hyppigst affiserte nivåene er C2-C3 (36%) og C5-C6 (35%).

 

 
 2. Muskel- og ligamentskader

 De dype nakkemusklene og ligamentene - spesielt rundt Øvre nakkeledd (C1-C2) - får ofte mikroskader. MR-studier har vist fettinfiltrasjon i disse musklene etter whiplash.

 

 
 3. Trigeminocervikal konvergens

 Smertenerver fra nakken (C1-C3) måter trigeminusnerven i hjernestammen. Dette forklarer hvorfor nakkeskade gir hodepine - smertesignaler fra nakken "feiltolkes" som hodepine.

 

 
 4. Sentral sensitivisering

 Ved kronisk nakkesleng kan nervesystemet bli overfålsomt. Systematiske oversikter bekrefter at kronisk WAD involverer sentral sensitivisering med lavere smerteterskler og førsterket smerteoppfattelse (Van Oosterwijck et al., 2013).

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Osteoporose og kompresjonsfrakturer i ryggen.

Symptomer

 

 Her kommer en overraskende opplysning: 65-75 % av alle vertebrale frakturer gir ingen eller minimale symptomer (AAFP, 2016). Mange oppdages tilfeldig på røntgen eller MR tatt av andre Årsaker.

 Når symptomer oppstår, ser jeg ofte:

 
 Plutselig, intens smerte midt i ryggen eller i overgangen bryst-/korsrygg - lignende brystryggsmerter

 Smerten forverres ved stillingsendring, hosting eller løfting

 Bedring i hvile og liggende stilling

 Gradvis høydetap over tid

 Økende krumning av Øvre rygg (kyfose) - se krum rygg

 

 
 Det typiske scenarioet

 En eldre person, ofte kvinne, opplever plutselig kraftig ryggsmerte etter å ha bøyd seg ned eller løftet noe lett. Det var intet tydelig fall eller traume.

 

 Nyttige kliniske tegn

 To kliniske tegn har vist seg nyttige:

 
 Knyttneve-perkusjonstesten (å banke lett på virvelen) har sensitivitet på 87,5 % og spesifisitet på 90 %.

 "Supine sign" - at pasienten ikke klarer å ligge flatt med kun en pute på grunn av smerte - har sensitivitet 81 % og spesifisitet 93 % (PMC, 2011).

Identify red flags for Red Flags for Back Pain.

Cauda Equina Syndrome - Emergency Situation

 Cauda equina syndrome (CES) occurs when the nerve bundle at the bottom of the spinal cord becomes
 compressed, usually by a large disc herniation . The condition affects
 approximately 1.6 per 100,000 per year - rare, but very serious.

 1.6 
 per 100,000 per year 

 48h 
 critical time window 

 84% 
 have bladder symptoms 

 Symptoms to Watch For

 Cauda Equina Symptoms

 Bladder dysfunction (84%): Difficulty starting urination, weak stream, feeling of
 incomplete emptying, or urinary incontinence

 Saddle anesthesia (71%): Numbness or altered sensation around the rectum, genitals,
 and inner thighs

 Bowel dysfunction (62%): Altered bowel control

 Bilateral leg weakness: Weakness in both legs that develops rapidly

 Why is it urgent?

 Deterioration can occur at approximately 1% per hour. Delay beyond 48 hours was associated with 9.6
 times increased mortality. There is no "safe" waiting time.

Pasient spør: "Hva er forskjellen på skulderartrose og frossen skulder?"

Skulderartrose er slitasje i selve leddet (brusken). Frossen skulder (adhesiv kapsulitt) er stivhet i leddkapselen uten nødvendigvis slitasje. Frossen skulder gir ofte mer uttalt bevegelsesinnskrenkning og går ofte over av seg selv.

Differensialdiagnoser ved POTS og Ortostatisk Svimmelhet?

Virusinfeksjon (vanligst)

 Omtrent 50% av POTS-tilfeller starter etter en virusinfeksjon - spesielt mononukleose (kyssesyke), influenså og COVID-19. Blant pasienter med langvarig COVID rapporterer 2-14% POTS-symptomer.

Fysisk traume

 Whiplash-skader , hjernerystelse og andre traumer mot hode og nakke er kjente utlosere. Det er en dokumentert sammenheng mellom nakkeskader og POTS-utvikling.

Tilknyttede tilstander

 POTS opptrer ofte sammen med andre tilstander: Hypermobilt Ehlers-Danlos syndrom (25% av POTS-pasienter), mastcelleaktiveringssyndrom (MCAS), migrene (40%), irritabel tarm (30%), og ME/CFS (21%).

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Scheuermann's Disease.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can Scheuermann's disease be cured?

 The structural change in the vertebrae is permanent. In adolescents, correct treatment
 (brace + exercise) can slow or stop progression. In adults, treatment focuses on
 symptoms and function, not structure.

 

 
 Is Scheuermann's the same as poor posture?

 No. Scheuermann's is a structural condition where the vertebrae themselves are shaped
 differently. Postural kyphosis is due to muscular habits and can be corrected actively.
 A person with Scheuermann's cannot "straighten up" in the same way.

 

 
 Will I always have pain?

 Not necessarily. As many as 25% of adults with Scheuermann's report no back pain. With
 proper exercise and lifestyle adaptation, many live well with the condition.

 

 
 Can I exercise normally?

 Yes, most forms of exercise are both safe and recommended. Swimming, strength training,
 running and yoga are all good alternatives. Be careful with very heavy lifting with
 axial loading (like heavy squats and deadlifts) if you have symptoms.

 

 
 Will my children inherit the condition?

 There is a significant genetic component (74% heritability), so children have increased
 risk. Be aware of posture changes in puberty and seek assessment if concerned.

 

 
 Do I need X-ray or MRI?

 X-ray confirms diagnosis and measures curve (Cobb angle). MRI is rarely necessary unless
 there is suspicion of other conditions or neurological symptoms.

 

 
 Does it get worse with age?

 The ...

Describe Self-help for Joint Problems for Clicking, Locking and Joint Problems in the Jaw.

Self-help for Joint Problems

 

 
 For Painless Clicking

 
 Don't do anything special: Learn to live with the sound

 Avoid "testing": Stop clicking intentionally

 Seek help if: Pain develops or opening becomes limited

 
 

 
 For Painful Clicking

 
 Soft diet: Avoid chewy, hard food for a period

 Heat: Warm cloth on the jaw 10-15 min

 Anti-inflammatory: Ibuprofen as needed

 Avoid extreme opening: Cut up apples, avoid giant burgers

 Sleep on your back: Avoid pressure on the jaw

 
 

 
 For Acute Locking

 
 Heat: Warm cloth 10-15 min to loosen muscles

 Gentle movement: Try careful side movements with the jaw

 Relaxation: Stress worsens muscle tension

 Seek treatment: If locking persists >24 hours

Clinical summary of Chiropractor During Pregnancy.

Key Takeaways

 Safe: A 2021 systematic review found only mild, temporary side effects from chiropractic treatment during pregnancy

 50-70% of pregnant women experience low back pain, and 20-25% develop pelvic pain (Vleeming et al. 2008)

 Adapted techniques: We use side-lying positions, gentle mobilisation, and specially designed pregnancy tables

 Drug-free: A safe alternative when ibuprofen and other medications are not recommended during pregnancy

Describe Phase 1: Relaxation (Start Here) for Jaw Exercises at Home: Complete Exercise Program for TMD.

Phase 1: Relaxation (Start Here)

 

 1. Breathing and Jaw Relaxation

 
 Sit or lie comfortably

 Close your eyes and breathe slowly through your nose

 On exhale: Let the jaw "fall" down slightly (lips still closed)

 Feel the jaw muscles relax more with each exhale

 5-10 breaths, repeat several times daily

 

 2. Resting Position Training

 
 Say the letter "N" softly

 Notice where your tongue is - against the palate behind the front teeth

 Let the teeth be separated by 2-3 mm

 Lips relaxed together

 This is the jaw's ideal resting position

 
 Tip: Set phone alarms to check your jaw position throughout the day.

 3. Progressive Muscle Relaxation for the Jaw

 
 Clench your teeth lightly for 5 seconds

 Relax completely for 10 seconds

 Notice the difference between tension and relaxation

 Repeat 5 times

 
 NB: Don't use maximum strength - only light tension!

Your feet contain 26 bones, 33 joints, and over 100 muscles, tendons, and ligaments. Yet most exercise programs completely ignore the foot. The result? Weak feet compensated for with stiff shoes and orthotics.

Patient asks: "What is the difference between SLAP lesion and biceps tendinopathy?"

SLAP lesion affects the attachment where the biceps tendon attaches to the
 labrum, while biceps tendinopathy affects the tendon itself.
 They can cause similar symptoms and occur together, but SLAP is more associated with overhead sports

Differential diagnoses for Trigger Finger: Complete Guide?

Repetitive gripping (Most common)

 Repeated gripping movements over time irritate the tendon sheath and cause thickening. Same mechanism
 as in mouse arm and other overuse conditions.

Diabetes

 Significantly increased risk - up to 10% of diabetics develop trigger finger. Diabetes also increases

Rheumatoid arthritis

 Inflammatory joint diseases increase risk of tendon disease.

Hormonal factors

 Women are affected 6 times more often than men, especially during menopause.

Describe What Happens in the Ear? for Meniere's Disease.

What Happens in the Ear?

 

 The underlying mechanism is believed to be endolymphatic hydrops - an accumulation of fluid (endolymph) in the inner ear. The inner ear consists of a labyrinth system filled with fluid that must have the right pressure and chemical composition to function normally.

 In Meniere's disease, too much fluid is produced, or drainage does not work properly. This causes the pressure to rise. At high pressure, a thin membrane (Reissner's membrane) can rupture, and fluids with different chemical compositions mix. This disrupts the signals to the brain and triggers the characteristic attack.

 
 Genetic Component

 Approximately 7-10% of patients with Meniere's disease have a family history of the condition.

How is Vestibular Migraine: When Dizziness Takes Over diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 Barany Society/IHS Diagnostic Criteria

 For a diagnosis of "Definite Vestibular Migraine," the following must be met:

 
 At least 5 episodes with vestibular symptoms of moderate to severe intensity

 Duration from 5 minutes to 72 hours

 Current or previous history of migraine (with or without aura)

 At least 50% of attacks must have at least one migraine feature: headache, light/sound sensitivity, or visual aura

 Symptoms cannot be better explained by another diagnosis

 

 Differential Diagnosis

 
 
 
 Condition

 Key Features
 
 
 
 
 Vestibular migraine

 Migraine features, gradual onset

 Seconds
 Abrupt onset, specific head position

 Hours
 Progressive hearing loss, unilateral fullness
 
 
 Vestibular neuritis
 Days
 Single episode, gradual improvement
 
 
 

 
 Red Flags - Seek Medical Attention For:

 
 Sudden, intense headache ("the worst headache of my life")

 Headache with fever and neck stiffness

 Unilateral hearing loss or tinnitus

 Double vision or vision loss

 Weakness or numbness in face, arm, or leg

 Speech or language difficulties

 Fainting in connection with dizziness

Forklar prognose: hvor lang tid tar det? for C5.

Prognose: Hvor lang tid tar det?

 Prognosen ved C5-C6 prolaps er generelt god. Forskning viser at det store flertallet blir bra med konservativ behandling, uten behov for kirurgi (Caridi et al., 2011; Radhakrishnan et al., 1994).

 85% 
 betydelig bedring uten kirurgi 

 2-4 
 uker til første merkbar bedring 

 8-12 
 uker median tid til betydelig bedring 

 Hva påvirker prognosen?

 Gode prognostiske faktorer

 Tidlig behandlingsstart

 Ung alder (under 50)

 Hovedsakelig radikular smerte (armsmerte dominerer)

 Ingen alvorlige nevrologiske utfall

 God funksjon i hverdagen tross smerte

 Faktorer som kan forlenge forløpet

 Forsinket behandlingsstart

 Samtidig depresjon eller angst

 Katastrofetanker om smerten

 Passiv mestringsstrategi (unngaelse, sengeleie)

 Langvarig nakkestivhet for symptomstart

 Kan prolapsen krympe?

 Ja. Diskprolapser kan faktisk reabsorberes over tid. Kroppen har en bemerkelsesverdig evne til å bryte ned og fjerne det utstikkende skivematerialet. Inflammasjonen rundt nerven avtar gradvis, og symptomene bedres ofte for selve prolapsen er helt borte.

 Studier viser at større prolapser (sekvestrerte) faktisk har bedre reabsorpsjonsrate enn mindre buklinger, fordi immunsystemet lettere "oppdager" og bryter ned det løse skivematerialet.

 referert smerte : smerte som kjennes et helt annet sted enn der

 Denne refererte smerten følger forutsigbare mønstre som er godt dokumentert i forskningen.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Thumb Arthritis (CMC.

What is thumb arthritis?: Thumb arthritis (CMC-1 arthritis, basal arthritis) is osteoarthritis in the joint at the base of the
 thumb - where the thumb meets the first metacarpal bone (carpometacarpal joint). This joint is
 particularly vulnerable because it gives the thumb its unique mobility, but also exposes it to great
 strain. The condition is sometimes confused with De Quervain's
 tenosynovitis or trigger finger , which also cause thumb problems.

Causes and risk factors: Heredity is by far the most important factor. If your mother has thumb arthritis, your risk is
 significantly increased.

Symptoms: Research shows that 72% of those with X-ray changes have no symptoms . Wear on the
 image is normal with age and doesn't always explain the pain you experience. Treatment should therefore
 focus on symptoms, not X-ray images.

Treatment: Thumb splint stabilizes the joint and reduces load. Can be used as needed or continuously.

Patient asks: "Does cervical myelopathy always require surgery?"

Not always, but surgery is the primary treatment that can directly address the actual compression of the spinal cord. AO Spine guidelines recommend surgery for moderate and severe myelopathy (mJOA below 15). For mild myelopathy (mJOA 15-17), structured observation with regular neurological monitoring may be considered, but 20-62% of these cases worsen over time.

 Akutt svimmelhet kombinert med hodepine, nakkesmerter eller nylig traume

 Talevansker, svelgevansker eller uklart sprak

 Lammelser, nummenhet eller svakhet i ansikt, arm eller ben

 Dobbeltsyn eller synsfeltutfall

 Endret bevissthet eller forvirring

Explain treatment for Tension Headache: Everything You Need to Know.

Treatment

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 Manual treatment has good evidence for tension headache. A systematic review and meta-analysis from 2020/2022 (Kamonseki et al., Disability and Rehabilitation) analyzed 15 randomized controlled trials with over 1100 participants
 Soft tissue treatment showed large effect
 Pain intensity: SMD -0.86 (large effect)

 Headache frequency: SMD -1.45 (large effect)

 Trigger point treatment had particularly good evidence
 Reduction of 3.5 attacks per month 

 Pain intensity reduced by 12.8 points (0-100 scale)

 (Falsiroli Maistrello et al., Frontiers in Neurology 2018) 

 In practice, I often combine several approaches: soft tissue treatment of tight muscles, trigger point therapy (manual or with needles), mobilization of stiff joints in the neck and upper back, as well as guidance on ergonomics and exercises.

 What Can You Do Yourself?

 Self-help strategies with documented effect

 Strength training for neck and shoulders: Moderate effect (SMD -0.84). Training makes the muscles more robust against static strain.

 Stress management and relaxation: EMG biofeedback and relaxation exercises have Level A evidence (EFNS 2010), with 45-60% average reduction in headache frequency.

 Regular breaks: Get up and move your neck regularly during screen work.

 Jaw tension: Be aware - release the jaw, let the tongue rest lightly.

 Prioritize sleep: Poor sleep lowers the pain threshold.

 Limit Painkillers

 Use of painkillers should be limited to max 2 days per week to avoid medication overuse headache . TTH patients with this complication have a 91% relapse rate after treatment.

 Treatment Course

 Most treatment studies use 1-2 treatments per week over 4-8 weeks, typically 6-12 treatments in total. Effect is usually assessed after 4-6 weeks. With episodic tension headache, many see improvement faster. With chronic form, you often need to work with multiple factors simultaneously.

Beskriv årsaker - fra vanligst til sjeldnest for Svimmel når du står opp.

Årsaker - fra vanligst til sjeldnest

 1. Ortostatisk hypotensjon (blodtrykksfall ved reising)

 Dette er den vanligste årsaken totalt sett, og utgjør rundt 42% av alle ortostatiske svimmelhetskasus (kardiovaskulær etiologi). Når du reiser deg, samler 500-1000 ml blod seg i beina på grunn av tyngdekraften. Normalt kompenserer kroppen ved å øke pulsen og trekke sammen blodårene. Ved ortostatisk hypotensjon svikter disse mekanismene, og hjernen får midlertidig for lite blod.

 Hvem rammes oftest? Eldre over 65 år, personer som tar blodtrykksmedisiner, diabetikere (24% forekomst), og Parkinson-pasienter (30-40% forekomst).

 Typiske symptomer: Ørhet og ustøhet som oppstår sekunder til minutter etter at du reiser deg. Mange opplever at synet "gråner" eller får tunnelsyn. Symptomene forsvinner når du setter deg ned igjen. Viktig: Symptomene skjer aldri når du ligger flatt.

 2. Krystallsyke (BPPV)

 BPPV er den vanligste vestibulære årsaken til posisjonsvertigo. Livstidsprevalensen er 2,4% (von Brevern 2007), og BPPV utgjør 17-42% av diagnosene ved balanselaboratorier. Kvinner rammes dobbelt så ofte som menn.

 BPPV skyldes at små kalsiumkrystaller i det indre øret løsner og havner i buegangene. Dette sender falske rotasjonssignaler til hjernen.

 Typiske symptomer: Intens følelse av at rommet spinner. Episodene varer typisk 10-60 sekunder og utløses av hodebevegelser - inkludert når du snur deg i sengen. Kvalme er vanlig.

 3. Medikamentbivirkninger

 Over 250 medikamenter kan forårsake ortostatisk hypotensjon. De viktigste inkluderer
 Alfablokkere gir høyest risiko

 Trisykliske antidepressiva gir seks ganger økt risiko

 Vanndrivende medisiner

 Alle typer blodtrykksmedisin

 Forekomst etter aldersgruppe

 Aldersgruppe 
 Forekomst 

 Under 50 år 
 ~5% 

 60+ år 
 22% 

 Over 70 år 
 30% 

 Sykehjemsbeboere 
 24-50%

Differensialdiagnoser ved Tekstnakke: Fra mobilbruk til nakkesmerter?

Nakkesmerter og stivhet

 Vanligst 

 Verkende, dump smerte i nedre del av nakken og overgangen til skuldrene. Stivhet som forverres utover dagen, særlig etter lengre økter med mobilbruk.

Spenningshodepine

 Hodepine som starter i nakken og stråler opp mot bakhodet, tinningene og pannen. Ofte beskrevet som en "stramhet" rundt hodet.

Smerte mellom skulderbladene

 Brennende eller verkende ubehag i øvre rygg, mellom og under skulderbladene. Skyldes at musklene her jobber overtid for å holde hodet oppe.

Fremoverlent holdning

 Over tid utvikles en permanent fremoverlent holdning med "gåsenakke" og runde skuldre. Dette blir synlig selv når du ikke bruker telefonen.

Nummenhet og prikking

 I alvorligere tilfeller kan du kjenne nummenhet eller prikking som stråler ut i skulder og arm. Dette tyder på at nervestrukturer begynner å bli irritert.

Har du lagt merke til at du hever skuldrene når du stresser? Det er ikke tilfeldig. Øvre trapezius - den store muskelen som løper fra nakken ut mot skuldrene - er en av kroppens mest stressfølsomme muskler.

 At uttrykket "smerte i nakken" har blitt synonymt med irritasjon og stress, er ingen tilfeldighet. Moderne arbeidsliv skaper perfekte forhold for det mange kaller "stressnakke".

Hva sier ny forskning om behandling?

 

 Slutt på "cocoon"-tilnærmingen

 Amsterdam Consensus Statement fra 2023 - den mest omfattende gjennomgangen av hjernerystelsesforskning noensinne (78 000 studier vurdert) - snur opp ned på gammel praksis.

 
 Tidligere vs. ny anbefaling

 Tidligere anbefaling: Total hvile fra all fysisk og kognitiv aktivitet til symptomfrihet.

 Ny anbefaling: 24-48 timer med relativ hvile, deretter gradvis oppstart av lett aerob aktivitet. Streng hvile ("cocooning") er ikke gunstig og kan faktisk forlenge bedringen.

 

 
 En randomisert studie med 103 ungdommer viste at de som startet kontrollert trening tidlig ble friske på median 13 dager, mot 17 dager for gruppen som bare hvilte. Forlenget bedring over 30 dager rammet bare 4% i treningsgruppen mot 14% i hvilegruppen.

 Pasienten sitter på benken med hodet dreid 45 grader mot den mistenkte siden, legges raskt bakover til hodet henger 20 grader under horisontalplanet. Ved bakre kanal BPPV ses oppslaende, roterende nystagmus etter noen sekunders forsinkelse.

 

 
 Supine roll-test

 Pasienten ligger flatt på ryggen og hodet rulles raskt fra side til side. Tester for horisontal kanal BPPV.

Beskriv Hva er svimmelhet? for Svimmelhet - Komplett guide.

Hva er svimmelhet?

 

 Svimmelhet er ikke en ting. Det er et paraplybegrep som dekker flere ulike opplevelser:

 
 Tre typer svimmelhet

 
 Vertigo: Følelsen av at du eller omgivelsene roterer. Rommet spinner, eller du føler at du snurrer rundt selv om du star stille. Dette skyldes nesten alltid forstyrrelser i balanseorganet.

 Uståhet: Beskrives ofte som en gyngende eller vuggende følelse - som å stå på et bøtdekk. Du føler deg ikke helt stabil på beina.

 Ørhet: En diffus følelse av å våre "tØkete" i hodet. Noen beskriver det som at de nesten skal besvime.

 
 

 Hvordan balansen fungerer

 Tre systemer sender kontinuerlig informasjon til hjernen:

 
 
 👂

 Balanseorganet

 I det indre Øret - registrerer hodets bevegelser og posisjon

 

 
 👁

 Øynene

 Forteller hjernen hvor du befinner deg i forhold til omgivelsene

 

 
 🦶

 Kroppssansen

 Sensorer i muskler, sener og ledd gir beskjed om kroppens stilling

 

 

 Når alle tre systemene sender samsvarende signaler, føler du deg stabil. Når ett system sender feil informasjon - eller systemene sender motstridende signaler - oppstar svimmelhet.

 Alder 20-40 Ør for traumatiske lesjoner

 Svak scapula-kontroll

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain treatment for Mal de Debarquement Syndrome.

Treatment

 Important to Know

 MdDS is a challenging condition to treat. Research is limited, and there is no standard treatment that helps everyone. A scoping review from 2023 identified improvement with several treatment methods, but emphasized that evidence is still limited.

 Specialized Treatment - VOR Readaptation (Dai Protocol)

 The most promising treatment is optokinetic VOR readaptation, developed by Dr. Mingjia Dai at Mount Sinai Hospital. The treatment involves visual stimulation with moving stripes in the visual field, while passively rolling the head from side to side, over repeated sessions.

 Results
 ~70% achieved significant improvement immediately after treatment

 After 1 year, 52% of motion-triggered cases were still significantly improved

 Patients treated within 1 year of symptom onset had better prognosis (62%) than those with symptom duration over 3 years (30%)

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 Honest expectation management: Research shows that chiropractic and physiotherapeutic treatment has no documented effect on the MdDS symptoms themselves.

 However, the chiropractor can contribute with
 Thorough assessment - Many with dizziness have other causes that can be treated

 Rule out mechanical causes - Neck problems can cause dizziness , but this is a different condition than MdDS

 Refer to the right specialist - ENT doctor or neurologist for further assessment

 Treat associated complaints - Neck and back pain that often accompanies long-term MdDS

 General vestibular screening - Detect other balance problems

Red Flags – When to Seek Help Immediately

 Emergency (call emergency services)

 Rapidly progressive weakness or numbness in the legs

 New-onset scoliosis with acute neurological symptoms

 Within 24–48 hours

 Pain combined with weakness or numbness in the legs

 Breathing difficulties related to the curve

 Planned Evaluation

 Persistent back pain in children or adolescents (unusual in idiopathic scoliosis – should be investigated for other causes)

 Left-sided thoracic curve (atypical pattern that may indicate an underlying cause)

Skriv henvisning til nevrokirurg for spinal stenose

Henvisning til nevrokirurgisk vurdering

Pasient: [Navn], [Fødselsdato]

Henvisningsårsak:
Lumbal spinal stenose med neurogen claudicatio.

Anamnese:
Pasienten har i 2 år hatt økende plager med smerter og tyngdefølelse i begge ben ved gange. Må stoppe og hvile etter ca 200 meter. Symptomene lindres ved å bøye seg fremover eller sette seg. Også smerter i korsryggen.

Kliniske funn:
- Stiv og flat lumbalcolumna
- Smerter ved lumbal ekstensjon
- Negativ SLR bilateralt
- Svake ankeldorsalfleksjoner (4/5) bilateralt

Beskriv Hva er vestibulær migrene? for Vestibulær Migrene: Når Svimmelheten Tar Over Livet.

Hva er vestibulær migrene?

 

 Vestibulær migrene er en nevrologisk tilstand der migrenemekanismene i hjernen påvirker balansesentrene i hjernestammen og lillehjernen. I motsetning til hva mange tror, trenger du ikke ha hodepine under et anfall. Faktisk opplever kun rundt 25% av pasientene hodepine samtidig med svimmelheten.

 Tilstanden rammer 1-3% av befolkningen og er langt vanligere enn Menieres sykdom, som mange feilaktig diagnostiseres med. I spesialiserte svimmelhetsklinikker utgjør vestibulær migrene opptil 25% av alle nyhenviste pasienter. Kvinner rammes oftere enn menn, med et forhold på omtrent 3-5:1.

 
 
 1-3%
 av befolkningen
 

 
 25%
 av svimmelhetsklinikk-pasienter
 

 
 7-8 Ør
 gjennomsnittlig tid til diagnose
 

 

 
 Hvorfor blir tilstanden så ofte oversett?

 Hodepine og svimmelhet opptrer sjelden samtidig. Pasienten kan ha hatt migrene i ungdommen som "forsvant," for så å utvikle uforklarlig svimmelhet 10-20 Ør senere. I en amerikansk undersøkelse var det bare 10% av pasientene som oppfylte kriteriene for vestibulær migrene som hadde fått beskjed om at migrene var Årsaken.

• L96 (Akutt indre skade kne) — traumatisk debut, positiv McMurray, låsningsepisoder

Differensialdiagnoser ved Du trenger ikke leve med svimmelhet lenger?

BPPV - krystallsyke

 BPPV (godartet posisjonsvertigo) er den vanligste arsaken til rotatorisk vertigo og utgjør 17-42% av spesialistklinikk-konsultasjoner. Tilstanden oppstår når små kalkpartikler løsner i det indre øret og havner i buegangene.

 Typiske kjennetegn: Korte, intense svimmelhetsanfall (sekunder til ett minutt) utløst av hodebevegelser - som å snu seg i sengen, bøye seg ned, eller se opp.

 Behandlingsrespons: StatPearls (2024) angir 80-90% reposisjonsrespons ved Epley-prosedyren. Mange opplever bedring etter en behandling, mens andre trenger 2-3 behandlinger. Suksessraten etter gjentatte behandlinger er over 90-95%.

Nakkerelatert svimmelhet (cervicogen svimmelhet)

 Vural et al. (2021) fant at opptil 40% av cervikalgi-pasienter også rapporterer cervikal dysekvilibrium. De øverste nakkevirvlene (C1-C3) inneholder en høy konsentrasjon av stillingssansreseptorer som sender informasjon til hjernen om hodets posisjon. Når disse signalene forstyrres, kan resultatet bli ustøhet og svimmelhet.

 Typiske kjennetegn: Vedvarende ustøhet som forverres ved nakkebevegelser, ofte kombinert med nakkesmerter og hodepine.

 Behandlingsrespons: En systematisk review fra 2011 konkluderte med at det finnes moderat evidens for manuell behandling ved cervicogen svimmelhet. Behandlingen kombineres ofte med spesifikke øvelser.

Vestibularisnevritt

 En betennelse i balansenerven, ofte etter virusinfeksjon. Gir plutselig, intens svimmelhet som varer i dager til uker.

 Behandlingsrespons: Vestibulær rehabilitering viser betydelig effekt. En Cochrane-review fant statistisk signifikant bedring sammenlignet med ingen behandling.

Andre årsaker

 Vestibulær migrene, Menieres sykdom, medikamentbivirkninger, og ortostatisk hypotensjon (blodtrykksfall ved reising) er blant andre vanlige årsaker. Noen ganger overlapper flere tilstander.

Describe Self-Help in the context of Occipital Neuralgia.

Self-Help

 
 Heat treatment: Heat pack on the neck can loosen muscles

 Ergonomics: Adjust your workstation to avoid forward head posture

 Stretching: Gentle stretching of neck muscles

 Avoid triggers: Identify and avoid positions/activities that trigger pain

 
 

 Medication Treatment

 If conservative treatment is insufficient, a doctor may consider:

 
 NSAIDs: Ibuprofen or similar for mild to moderate pain

 Neuropathic pain medications: Gabapentin, pregabalin, or amitriptyline

 Muscle relaxants: For significant muscle spasm

 
 With frequent use of painkillers (more than 10-15 days per month), be aware of the risk of medication overuse headache.

 Invasive Treatments

 For refractory cases, the following may be considered by a specialist:

 
 Occipital nerve block: Injection of local anesthetic +/- corticosteroid

 Botulinum toxin: Can reduce muscle tension and nerve activity

 Pulsed radiofrequency treatment

 Occipital nerve stimulator: For chronic, refractory cases

 
 

 
 
 
 7
 Prognosis

 

 The prognosis for occipital neuralgia varies depending on the underlying cause:

 
 Muscle-related: Often good prognosis with manual treatment and self-help

 Traumatic: May take longer, but often improves over months

 Idiopathic: Variable course - some experience spontaneous improvement, others develop chronic daily headache

 

 
 Many Get Better

 Most people with occipital neuralgia experience significant improvement with proper treatment. Conservative measures such as manual treatment, self-help, and medications often help. For those who don't respond, more invasive alternatives exist.

 Slapp av i kjeven: "Leppene sammen, tennene fra hverandre"

 Stresshandtering: AvspenningsØvelser og god søvn hjelper betydelig

 Forsiktige toyninger: Rolige gapebevegelser og sideveis bevegelser

 
 

 Behandlingsforløp

Hvordan diagnostiseres Vondt i Hoften? - Komplett guide?

Gjor-det-selv tester: Finn ut mer for du kommer

 

 For du bestiller time, kan du prøve disse enkle testene hjemme. De gir ofte en god pekepinn på hva som er galt - og gjør at jeg kommer raskere til bunns i problemet.

 
 
 1
 Sokke-testen (sjekker hofteleddet)

 

 
 Slik gjør du: Sitt på en stol. Prov å ta på deg sokker på den vonde siden uten å bøye ryggen mye - ved å trekke foten opp mot deg og rotere hoften utover.

 Resultat: Er det vanskelig eller gjør vondt dypt i lysken? Studier viser at dette er mye vanligere ved hofteartrose enn ved seneplager på utsiden. Det tyder på stivhet i selve hofteleddet.

 

 

 
 
 2
 Ett-bens-testen (sjekker setesenene)

 

 
 Slik gjør du: Stå på det vonde benet i 30 sekunder. Hold deg lett i veggen for balanse om nødvendig.

 Resultat: Hvis dette reproduserer den kjente smerten på utsiden av hoften, tyder det sterkt på GTPS (gluteal tendinopati). En fersk meta-analyse viste at denne testen har 94% sensitivitet og 99% spesifisitet for seneproblemer på utsiden av hoften.

 

 

 
 
 3
 Peke-testen (sjekker SI-ledd vs. hofte)

 

 
 Slik gjør du: Hvor sitter smerten? Prov å peke på det vondeste punktet med en finger.

 Resultat: Peker du rett på "smilehullet" eller gropen ved korsryggen? Da kommer smerten sannsynligvis fra SI-leddet (bekkenleddet), ikke hoften. Peker du derimot på lysken (ofte formet som en C med handen), er det oftere selve hofteleddet.

Describe causes and risk factors for Cervical Disc Herniation and Pinched Nerve in the Neck.

Causes and risk factors

 Interestingly, only 14.8% had physical exertion or trauma just before symptom onset in the Rochester
 study. Most cases develop gradually without a specific triggering event.

 Causes ranked from most to least common

 Spondylosis and foraminal stenosis (68-75%)

 Age-related changes gradually lead to narrowing of the opening where the nerve passes. Dominant cause
 in people over 50.

 Disc herniation (20-25%)

 Acute bulging of the intervertebral disc pressing on the nerve root. Most common in younger patients
 in their 20s-40s.

 Injury/trauma (~15%)

 Whiplash -type injuries or other neck trauma.

 Myofascial trigger points

 Active trigger points in the upper trapezius occur in 30-40% of patients with chronic neck pain . Causes radiation that can mimic radiculopathy.

 Risk factors

 Age over 50

 Heavy physical work with lifting over 25 kg

 Work with vibrating equipment

 Prolonged driving

 Smoking (affects blood supply to discs)

 Sedentary work with poor ergonomics

 Previous back pain (41% have had lumbar radiculopathy)

Describe different types of clicking sounds for Why Does My Shoulder Click? Causes and When to Worry.

Different Types of Clicking Sounds

 Not all clicking is the same. The sound and sensation can give hints about what's causing it
 "Pop" or "click"

 A single, audible sound - like when you crack your knuckles

 This is often gas bubbles being released in the joint (cavitation). Completely harmless and natural.
 You typically won't be able to reproduce the sound immediately afterwards.

 "Crunching" or "crackling"

 A more creaking, repetitive sound during movement

 Can be caused by tendons sliding over bony structures, bursa irritation, or in some cases early
 arthritic changes. Often harmless, but worth observing.

 "Clunk" or "snap"

 A feeling of something "jumping" or shifting

 Often a tendon (e.g., the biceps tendon) snapping over a bony prominence. Can occur with certain
 movements and is usually harmless.

 "Grinding" or "grating"

 A rough, scraping feeling/sound during movement

 May indicate cartilage changes or arthritis. More relevant to investigate, especially if accompanied
 by stiffness or pain.

Describe treatment options for Dizziness - Complete Guide.

Prevention and Self-Treatment

 

 
 Measures You Can Do Yourself

 
 Move: The myth of bed rest for dizziness has been debunked. Adapted movement
 stimulates the balance system and helps the brain recalibrate.

 Vitamin D: Several meta-analyses show a connection between low vitamin D levels and
 BPPV. Supplementation may reduce relapse risk (Yang, J Neurol, 2020).

 Hydration: Drink sufficient fluids. Dehydration can worsen dizziness symptoms.

 Ergonomics: Screen at eye level, avoid forward-leaning head posture, take breaks
 every 30 minutes.

 Stress management: Stress worsens many forms of dizziness. Simple breathing
 exercises can calm an overactive nervous system.

 Secure your home: Remove loose rugs, ensure good lighting, use support handles in
 the bathroom.

Myth 7: "It's all in your head"

 Fact: Dizziness is a real medical condition with concrete physical causes. That many also develop anxiety in connection with dizziness is understandable - the fear that symptoms will recur can be very burdensome.

 But anxiety resulting from dizziness is not the same as dizziness being "all in your head." A thorough examination will reveal whether there are underlying vestibular or musculoskeletal causes.

What causes Whiplash?

Causes and risk factors

 

 Most common causes

 
 Car accidents (whiplash)

 The classic cause. During rear-end collision, the neck is exposed to rapid acceleration-deceleration
 that can damage soft tissues.

 

 
 Sports injuries

 Contact sports such as football, rugby, and martial arts increase risk through direct impacts or
 falls.

 

 
 Falls and accidents

 Falls from height or sudden movements can cause soft tissue injuries.

 

 Risk factors for prolonged symptoms

 Research has identified several factors that increase the risk of chronic symptoms (Walton et al.,
 2013):

 
 High pain intensity from the start (above 5.5/10)

 High functional disability from the start

 Catastrophizing (excessive worry about symptoms)

 Fear of movement

 Previous neck problems

 Post-traumatic stress symptoms

 

 
 Interesting finding

 Research shows that the collision itself (direction, speed, headrest type) does not significantly
 affect prognosis. Imaging findings also do not predict prognosis - psychosocial factors matter far
 more.

Differential diagnoses for Sports Injuries?

Acute Injuries

 Result from a single traumatic event - a fall, collision, or sudden movement. Examples include ankle sprains, muscle tears, and ligament ruptures. These typically cause immediate pain and swelling.

Overuse Injuries

 Develop gradually from repetitive stress over time. Examples include tendinopathies (Achilles, patellar), stress fractures, and shin splints. Pain often starts mild and worsens if training continues unchanged.

Describe treatment options for Dizziness - Causes, Symptoms and Effective Treatment.

Treatment Options

 

 
 BPPV

 Repositioning maneuvers (Epley/Semont) have an 80-90% success rate. Many experience significant improvement after 1-3 treatments.

 

 
 Neck-Related Dizziness

 Manual treatment, joint corrections and specific exercises. Typically 4-8 treatments over a few weeks.

 

 
 Vestibular Neuritis

 Vestibular rehabilitation and compensation training. 4-12 week program for more complex conditions.

 

 
 Meniere's Disease

 Lifestyle changes, medications and specialist follow-up.

 

 Vestibular Rehabilitation

 Vestibular rehabilitation is specialized physical therapy for the balance system with documented effect:

 
 Gaze stabilization - Exercises to maintain focus during head movements

 Balance exercises - Progressive training on challenging surfaces

 Habituation - Exposure to movements that trigger symptoms

 

 
 Most people with dizziness improve significantly with proper treatment. The key is finding the right diagnosis first.

Describe treatment options for POTS and Orthostatic Dizziness.

Treatment

 

 There is no cure for POTS, but most people experience significant improvement with the right treatment. Non-pharmacological measures are first-line treatment.

 Non-Pharmacological Treatment

 
 Fluids and salt: Drink 2-3 liters of water daily, start the day with 500 ml water BEFORE getting up. For POTS (without high blood pressure), increased salt intake is often recommended (6-10 grams daily). Always consult a doctor

 Compression: Class 2 compression stockings, best effect with stockings that go to the waist

 Diet: Eat small, frequent meals. Avoid large carbohydrate-rich meals

 

 
 The Levine Protocol: Exercise as Medicine

 Exercise is the well-documented treatment for POTS, but must be done correctly:

 
 Phase 1 (month 1-2): Horizontal exercise: rowing machine, recumbent bike, swimming

 Phase 2: Gradual introduction of upright exercise

 Phase 3: Maintenance with combined training

 
 

 
 Results from Research

 In Fu and Levine's study from 2011, 3 months of training showed that 53% of participants no longer met POTS criteria. Exercise was more effective than beta-blockers for reducing pulse and improving quality of life.

 

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 POTS is primarily a medical condition that requires evaluation by a doctor. But the chiropractor can play a role in several areas:

 
 Diagnostic contribution: I can perform active standing tests and identify if your dizziness may be due to POTS - rather than problems in the balance organ. If s...

Clinical summary of Tarsal Tunnel Syndrome.

Summary

 What it is: Compression of the posterior tibial nerve in the tarsal tunnel behind the inner ankle

 Common causes: Flat feet/overpronation, ganglion cysts, ankle injuries, idiopathic (20-40%)

 Treatment: Nerve mobilization has moderate evidence from two RCTs. Biomechanical correction helps about 50%

 Red flags: Increasing numbness, weakness in toes, or no improvement after 3-6 months

 Consultation: 45 min first visit, 30 min follow-up

Explain Spondylolisthesis: Vertebral Slippage to a patient.

You may have been told that you have spondylolisthesis - that a vertebra in your spine has slipped
 forward. The word sounds dramatic, and it's natural to be worried. But what does it actually mean for
 you?

 Spondylolisthesis is actually quite common, and most cases are mild and can be managed well without
 surgery. Let's look at what this condition involves, how it's graded, and what you can do to live well
 with it.

 The most important thing to understand is that a structural change on an image doesn't necessarily
 mean you have to have pain. Many people with spondylolisthesis live completely symptom-free.

Beskriv symptomer — kropp og hode henger sammen for Overtrening og Overbelastning.

Symptomer — kropp og hode henger sammen

 Overtrening rammer hele systemet. Det starter ofte fysisk, men de psykiske symptomene kan være like ødeleggende. En dårlig treningsuke gir kanskje ett eller to av disse tegnene. OTS gir mange av dem — samtidig — over tid.

 Fysiske tegn

 Vedvarende prestasjonsfall — du trener like hardt eller hardere, men presterer dårligere

 Forhøyet hvilepuls — 5+ slag over normalen, særlig om morgenen

 Forlenget restitusjon — du er støl lenger enn vanlig etter trening

 Hyppigere forkjølelser og infeksjoner (immunsuppresjon)

 Søvnproblemer — paradoksalt nok sover du dårligere jo mer sliten du er

 Økt skadefrekvens — belastningsskader, stressreaksjoner og tendinopatier

 Appetittendringer — ofte redusert matlyst

 Uforklart vekttap 

 Psykiske tegn

 Motivasjonstap — du gleder deg ikke til trening lenger

 Irritabilitet og humørsvingninger

 Angst eller nedstemthet 

 Konsentrasjonsvansker 

 Følelse av å gå på tomgang 

 To former for OTS

 Sympatisk form: Vanligst ved eksplosive idretter (sprint, styrkeløft). Kjennetegnes av forhøyet hvilepuls, rastløshet og søvnløshet.

 Parasympatisk form: Vanligst ved utholdenhetsidretter (langdistanse, sykling). Kjennetegnes av lav puls, tretthet og depresjon. Ofte vanskeligere å oppdage fordi utøveren virker «rolig» utad.

Differensialdiagnoser ved lateral hoftesmerte:

1. Gluteal tendinopati / Trokanterittt bursitt (mest sannsynlig)
   - Typisk: Smerte over trochanter major, verst sideleie, trapper, gange
   - Tester: Palpasjon trochanter, FABER, resisted hip abduction
   - Behandling: Eksentrisk styrking, shockwave, unngå sideleie

2. IT-bånd syndrom
   - Smerte lateralt, kan stråle nedover
   - Forverres ved repetitiv fleksjon/ekstensjon
   - Ober's test positiv

3. Referert smerte fra lumbal columna (L4-L5)
   - Kan gi lateral hoftesmerte
   - Sjekk lumbal ROM, SLR, nevrologisk

4. Hofteleddsartrose
   - Vanligvis lyskesmerte, men kan gi lateral smerte
   - Redusert IR, FABER positiv

5. Meralgia paraesthetica (n. cutaneus femoris lateralis)
   - Brennende/prikking anterolateralt lår
   - Sensorisk, ikke motorisk

Anbefalt undersøkelsesstrategi:
- Palpasjon trochanter major og gluteal sener
- FABER, FADIR for hofteledd
- Lumbal screening for referert smerte
- Resisted hip abduction i sideleie
- Trendelenburg test

Describe Repetitive work in the context of Carpal Tunnel Syndrome: Complete Guide.

Repetitive work

 Office work, cashier work, production work - anything with repeated hand movements over time. See also
 mouse arm.
 

 

 Important risk factors

 
 Gender: Women are affected 3 times more often than men

 Pregnancy: Common in the last trimester (fluid retention)

 Diabetes: Increased risk of nerve disease in general

 Obesity: BMI over 30 significantly increases risk

 Arthritis: Inflammation can affect the tendon sheaths

 Hereditary: Tends to run in families

 
 

 
 
 3
 Symptoms

 

 The symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome are often characteristic:

 
 Typical symptoms

 
 Tingling and numbness in thumb, index finger, middle finger and half of ring finger
 

 Night symptoms - waking up with "sleeping" hand

 Pain that can radiate up into the forearm

 Weakness - dropping things, problems with buttons

 "Electric shocks" in the fingers

 
 

 Why is it worst at night?

 Most people sleep with bent wrists, either under the head or curled toward the chest. When the wrist is
 bent, pressure in the carpal tunnel increases significantly - up to 10 times normal. This
 compresses the nerve and causes symptoms.

 
 Symptoms that worsen over time

 Without treatment, carpal tunnel syndrome can lead to:

 
 Constant numbness (not just at night)

 Muscle wasting at thumb base (thenar atrophy)

 Permanent nerve damage

 
 The earlier treatment starts, the better the prognosis.

 

 Where are your symptoms?

 
 
 
 Condition
 Fingers affected
 
 
 
 
 Carpal tunnel syndrome
 Thumb, index, middle, half ring finger
 
 
 Cubital tunnel syndrome
 Little finger, half ring finger
 
 
 Cervical radiculopathy
 Varies with nerve root, often entire arm
 
 
 
 

 
 
 4
 Diagnosis

 

 Diagnosis is primarily based on medical history and clinical examination. Provocation tests can confirm
 suspicion:

 
 Phalen's test

 Hold wrists flexed for 60 seconds. Positive test: symptoms in the median nerve area are triggered.

Forklar behandling for Temporalisarteritt.

Behandling

 Behandling av temporalisarteritt er tidskritisk og livslang . Rask oppstart med kortison er det viktigste tiltaket for å forebygge synstap.

 Behandling starter FØR diagnosen er bekreftet

 Ved sterk klinisk mistanke om temporalisarteritt skal høydose kortison startes umiddelbart - samme dag som mistanken oppstår. Man venter IKKE på biopsi, ultralyd eller blodprøvesvar. Behandlingsgevinsten ved tidlig oppstart overgår langt risikoen ved noen dagers kortison til en eventuelt frisk person.

 Akuttbehandling: Høydose kortison

 Prednisolon 40-60 mg daglig - standarddose ved GCA uten synssymptomer (EULAR/BSR-retningslinjer)

 Intravenøs metylprednisolon 500-1000 mg i 3 dager - ved synstap eller truende synstap, etterfulgt av høydose oral prednisolon

 Dramatisk respons: De fleste opplever betydelig bedring av hodepine og allmennsymptomer innen 24-72 timer

 Manglende respons på kortison bør vekke tvil om diagnosen

 Langtidsbehandling: Gradvis nedtrapping

 Etter akuttfasen trappes prednisolondosen gradvis ned over 1-2 år . Nedtrappingen styres av symptomer og betennelsesmarkører (SR/CRP). For rask nedtrapping gir høy risiko for tilbakefall. Noen pasienter trenger vedlikeholdsdoser i flere år.

 Tocilizumab - kortisonsparende behandling

 Tocilizumab (IL-6-hemmer) ble godkjent som tilleggsbehandling etter den banebrytende GiACTA-studien (Stone et al., New England Journal of Medicine 2017). Studien viste at tocilizumab kombinert med kortisonnedtrapping ga høyere andel pasienter i vedvarende remisjon, med betydelig lavere total kortisondose. Dette er spesielt gunstig for pasienter med høy risiko for kortisonbivirkninger.

 Oppfølging

 Revmatolog: Regelmessig oppfølging for å styre behandlingen

 Øyelege: Ved ethvert synssymptom under sykdomsforløpet

 Benskjørhetsprofylakse: Langvarig kortisonbruk krever forebygging av osteoporose (kalsium, vitamin D, eventuelt bisfosfonater)

 Blodprøvekontroller: SR/CRP monitoreres regelmessig for å oppdage tilbakefall

Beskriv diagnostikk for Horisontal Kanal BPPV.

Diagnostikk

 Supine roll-test (gullstandarden)

 Pasienten ligger på ryggen med hodet hevet 30 grader. Hodet dreies raskt 90 grader til en side og holdes i 30-60 sekunder mens øyebevegelser observeres. Deretter gjentas testen til motsatt side. Testens sensitivitet er rapportert til 89,5% (Barany Society Guidelines).

 Ved geotropisk variant

 Øynene slær mot bakken på begge sider, men sterkest på den affiserte siden.

 Ved apogeotropisk variant

 Øynene slær bort fra bakken, og den svakeste responsen er på den affiserte siden.

 Viktig rekkefølge

 Supine roll-testen bør ideelt utføres får Dix-Hallpike-testen, da Dix-Hallpike kan flytte krystaller og påvirke resultatene.

 Røde flagg - kontakt lege umiddelbart ved
 Svimmelhet som varer kontinuerlig over 2 minutter (BPPV gir korte anfall)

 Plutselig hørselstap eller kraftig øresus

 Dobbeltsyn eller andre synsforstyrrelser

 Kraftig hodepine ulikt tidligere opplevd

 Ansiktslammelse, nummenhet eller taleforstyrrelser

 Koordinasjonsproblemer eller ustø gange

 overbelastningsskader som utvikles over tid. Forståelse av de ulike skadene,
 deres mekanismer og behandling er avgjørende for optimal tilheling og sikker
 retur til idretten.

2 De vanligste idrettsskadene: Lyskestrekk er den vanligste idrettsskaden i hofteregionen, spesielt i idretter
 med hurtige retningsforandringer, spark og akselerasjon. Skaden rammer adduktorene
 å musklene på innsiden av læret som trekker benet innover.

5 Return-to-Sport: Faseinndelt tilbakegang: En gradvis, kriteriebasert tilbakegang til idretten reduserer risikoen for
 nye skader betydelig. Her er de typiske fasene
6 Forebygging av idrettsskader: En spesifikk øvelse som har vist seg å redusere lyskeskader med opptil 41% i fotball.
 Øvelsen gjøres i sideliggende posisjon der partneren holder det øverste benet, og
 utøveren løfter kroppen opp med det nederste benet. Start med 2x5 repetisjoner og
 Øk gradvis til 3x15.

Treatment Works - Even Without Classic Presentation

 Perhaps the most important finding: Subtle BPPV responds to repositioning maneuver even without visible nystagmus. 

 Treatment Success for Subjective BPPV

 Balatsouras study: 87.5% (45 patients)

 Meta-analysis 2013: 67.64% remission for BPPV without nystagmus

Describe PPPD: When Dizziness Becomes Chronic for Dizzy from Stress and Anxiety - When Brain and Balance Are Connected.

PPPD: When Dizziness Becomes Chronic

 

 Persistent Postural-Perceptual Dizziness (PPPD) is the most common form of chronic functional dizziness. The condition affects 15-23% of patients at specialist clinics.

 
 Who Gets PPPD?

 
 Women are affected four times more often than men

 Typical age of onset: 30-50 years

 Often triggered by a vestibular event, migraine, panic attack, or concussion

 
 

 
 Diagnostic Criteria (Barany Society 2017)

 All five criteria must be met:

 
 Duration: Dizziness, unsteadiness, or non-rotational vertigo most days for at least 3 months

 Aggravating factors: Symptoms worsen with upright posture, movement, and visually complex environments

 Triggering event: Started after vestibular disease, migraine, panic attack, or concussion

 Symptoms cause significant discomfort or functional impairment

 Not better explained by another condition

You are a diagnosis code specialist for chiropractic in Norway. You help select the correct ICPC-2 codes based on clinical findings and symptoms. Always provide the code first, then a brief explanation.
Acute vs chronic low back pain — difference in coding?

Acute vs chronic low back:

- Acute (<6 weeks): L03 — Low back symptom
- Subacute (6-12 weeks): L03 or L84 depending on workup
- Chronic (>12 weeks): L84 — Back syndrome without radiation

Transition from L03 → L84 when:
- Pain persists >12 weeks
- Clinical syndrome identified
- Imaging shows pathology

Error: Using L03 for chronic pain lasting 2 years without reassessment.

Describe treatment options for Ear Symptoms from the Jaw: Tinnitus, Ear Pain and Dizziness in TMD.

Treatment Course and Prognosis

 

 Typical treatment course is 6-12 treatments over 4-8 weeks.

 
 Important About Timing

 Improvement in tinnitus often comes 2-3 weeks after jaw pain begins to subside. Full effect can take 3-6 months. Ear fullness is often the symptom that responds fastest.

 

 For properly selected patients - those with clear connection between jaw and ear symptoms - studies show that 44-83% achieve significant improvement in tinnitus, and about half experience complete or near-complete improvement.

 It is Important to be Realistic

 
 Not everyone responds equally well - some experience only partial improvement

 Relapses are common in TMD, especially with persistent stress or teeth clenching

 Treatment takes time - expect 3-6 months for optimal effect

 Many need maintenance treatment or periodic follow-up

 

 
 
 83%
 significant tinnitus improvement
 

 
 3-6 weeks
 typical time to improvement
 

 
 6-12
 treatments typical

Provide a structured clinical overview of Pelvic Girdle Pain in Pregnancy.

What is pelvic girdle pain in pregnancy?: Pelvic girdle pain in pregnancy (PGP - Pelvic Girdle Pain) is pain in the pelvic
 region that occurs during pregnancy. It is one of the most common hip and
 pelvic problems pregnant women experience.

Causes: During pregnancy, the body produces hormones that make the ligaments more elastic
Treatment: Yes! Chiropractic treatment is safe and effective during pregnancy when performed by
 an experienced practitioner. Research supports the use of manual treatment for pelvic pain during
 pregnancy.

After giving birth: Most experience significant improvement within the first months after giving birth. Hormone levels
 normalize and the pelvis regains stability.

Key Takeaways

 No age limit: We treat patients well into their 90s with adapted techniques

 60-80% of adults over 65 have musculoskeletal pain (PMC 2012) — pain relief is realistic at any age

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain treatment for Hip Pointer.

Treatment

 What Can a Chiropractor Do?

 The chiropractor can play a role in the subacute phase and rehabilitation
 Thorough examination - assess severity and rule out fractures/other diagnoses

 Referral for imaging - chiropractors can refer for X-ray and MRI when needed

 Soft tissue treatment - after the acute phase (>48-72 hours) to release tension in
 surrounding muscles

 Joint mobilization - gentle restoration of hip mobility

 Rehabilitation guidance - exercises for strength and mobility tailored to the
 healing process

 Important: Manual treatment is contraindicated in the acute phase (first 48-72 hours).
 Aggressive massage or deep tissue work too early can increase the risk of complications like myositis
 ossificans.

 Self-Care

 PRICE protocol (first 48-72 hours)
 Protection - avoid activities that worsen pain

 Rest - relative rest, not necessarily complete immobilization

 Ice - 15-20 minutes every 2-3 hours, never directly on skin

 Compression - elastic bandage if possible

 Elevation - lie with hip elevated when possible

 "NO HARM" rule for the first days: No heat, no alcohol, no running, no massage.

Describe Which nerves are affected - and what characterizes each? for Cervical Disc Herniation and Pinched Nerve in the Neck.

Which nerves are affected - and what characterizes each?

 

 The neck has seven cervical vertebrae, and the nerves exiting between them are named after the vertebra
 above. Note: Only 62.6% of patients have standard dermatome patterns, and 67.3% show typical myotome
 patterns (Neurospine 2022). About one-third have atypical symptoms.

 
 C7 radiculopathy (most common - 60-70% of cases)

 
 Disc level: C6-C7

 Sensory: Tingling, numbness in the middle
 finger (finger 3). May also be felt on the back of the forearm.

 Muscle weakness: Triceps (elbow extension), wrist flexors and finger extensors.
 

 Reflex change: Reduced triceps reflex.

 
 

 
 C6 radiculopathy (second most common - 20-25%)

 
 Disc level: C5-C6

 Sensory: Tingling or numbness in thumb and index finger (fingers 1 and 2).

 Muscle weakness: Biceps and wrist extensors.

 Reflex change: Reduced biceps reflex and/or brachioradialis reflex.

 
 NOTE: C6 radiculopathy
 shows the most variation - only 47.6% present with typical pattern.

 

 
 C5 radiculopathy (~5% of cases)

 
 Disc level: C4-C5

 Sensory: Pain and tingling in the shoulder area and outer upper arm.

 Muscle weakness: Deltoid (shoulder abduction) and biceps.

 Reflex change: Reduced biceps reflex.

 
 

 
 C8 radiculopathy (~5% of cases)

 
 Disc level: C7-T1

 Sensory: Numbness in ring and little finger (fingers 4 and 5) plus inner forearm.
 

 Muscle weakness: Small muscles of the hand and finger flexors. Causes problems
 with fine motor skills...

Patient asks: "Can tight hip flexors cause lower back pain?"

Yes, but they are rarely the sole cause. Tight hip flexors can contribute to altered pelvic position and increased load on the lower back, but the connection is weaker than many believe. Strength, movement control and overall load play equally important roles.

Diagnostikk

 

 Klinisk undersøkelse

 Som kiropraktor gjør jeg en grundig undersøkelse som inkluderer vurdering av gangmønster og holdning, testing av reflekser, kraft og fålsomhet i beina, og provokasjon av symptomer ved ulike stillinger.

 Bildediagnostikk - et viktig forbehold

 MR er førstevalgundersøkelse når bildediagnostikk er indisert. Men her kommer et svært viktig poeng: Det er ofte dårlig sammenheng mellom MR-funn og symptomer.

 
 MR-funn hos symptomfrie

 Studier viser at 21% av symptomfrie personer over 60 Ør har stenose på MR, og at 65% av friske frivillige fikk stenosediagnose av radiologer. Dette betyr at MR-bilder aldri bør styre behandlingen alene.

 

 Bildediagnostikk er mest aktuelt ved:

 
 Mistanke om alvorlig patologi (røde flagg)

 Vedvarende symptomer etter 6-8 ukers konservativ behandling

 Ved vurdering av kirurgi

Provide a structured clinical overview of NAV Reimbursement for Chiropractors in 2025.

What changed from 2025?: From 1 January 2025, the Norwegian Parliament (Stortinget) voted to discontinue the traditional reimbursement scheme for chiropractic care through the national budget for 2025. In practice, this meant that patients lost their right to financial support for treatment by a chiropractor.

What does this mean for you as a patient?: The most important message is that chiropractors function exactly as before .

What does chiropractic care cost in 2025?:  Check whether your insurance covers chiropractic care - many do.

Why was the reimbursement removed?: The government justified the change with the need to free up funds for other healthcare services. In the national budget for 2025, chiropractic care was characterised as "supplementary" treatment.

Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ): Yes. Chiropractors can still submit reimbursement claims for treatments performed in 2024. The deadline was 30 June 2025.

Conclusion: The changes in 2025 mean that you as a patient pay virtually the entire treatment cost yourself when visiting a chiropractor. The symbolic 4 NOK reimbursement reinstated in July 2025 makes no real financial difference.

Would you like an assessment?: . The first consultation is 45 minutes.

Describe Visually Triggered Dizziness (40%) in the context of Vestibular Migraine: When Dizziness Takes Over Your Life.

Visually Triggered Dizziness (40%)

 Worsens in busy visual environments (shopping centers, escalators). Scrolling on screens triggers symptoms.

 

 Accompanying Symptoms:

 
 Nausea (72% of patients)

 Light and sound sensitivity

 Pressure in head or ears

 Tinnitus - often high-frequency

 Neck pain and stiffness - very common! See also cervicogenic dizziness

 
 

 
 
 4
 Diagnosis

 

 Barany Society/IHS Diagnostic Criteria:

 For the diagnosis "Definite Vestibular Migraine" the following must be met:

 
 At least 5 episodes with vestibular symptoms of moderate to severe intensity

 Duration from 5 minutes to 72 hours

 Current or past history of migraine (with or without aura)

 At least 50% of attacks must have at least one migraine feature: headache, light/sound sensitivity, or visual aura

 Symptoms cannot be better explained by another diagnosis

 

 Differential Diagnosis:

 
 
 
 Condition
 Duration
 Distinctive Features
 
 
 
 
 Vestibular Migraine
 Minutes to hours
 Migraine features, gradual onset
 
 
 BPPV (Crystal Disease)
 Seconds
 Sudden onset, specific head position
 
 
 Meniere's Disease
 Hours
 Progressive hearing loss, unilateral fullness
 
 
 Vestibular Neuritis
 Days
 Single episode, gradual improvement
 
 
 

 
 Red Flags - See a Doctor or Emergency Room for:

 
 Sudden, intense headache ("the worst headache of my life")

 Headache with fever and neck stiffness

 Unilateral hearing loss or tinnitus

 Double vision or vision loss

 Weakness or numbness in face, arm or leg

 Speech or language difficulties

 Fainting in connection with dizziness

Beskriv Hvorfor kontorarbeid gir skuldersmerter for Skuldervennlig kontorplass: Slik setter du opp arbeidsstasjonen.

Hvorfor kontorarbeid gir skuldersmerter

 

 Kroppen var ikke designet for å sitte stille i samme stilling i timevis. Når vi gjør det, skjer flere ting som belaster skuldrene:

 
 Statisk muskelarbeid

 Når du holder armene foran deg for å bruke tastatur og mus, jobber skuldermusklene konstant for å stabilisere. Uten hvile fører dette til tretthet, spenninger og til slutt smerte.

 

 
 Fremoverlent holdning

 Mange lener seg fremover mot skjermen. Dette fører til at hodet kommer foran skuldrene, noe som Øker belastningen på nakke- og skuldermuskulatur betydelig.

 

 
 Loftede skuldre

 Stress, konsentrasjon eller feil pulthøyde gjør at vi ubevisst løfter skuldrene. Over tid gir dette kroniske spenninger i trapezius-muskelen. Dette kan også påvirke søvnkvaliteten.

 

 
 Ensidig belastning

 Musbruk med samme arm hele dagen, tastaturet for langt til en side - slike asymmetrier belaster den ene skulderen mer enn den andre. Dette kan over tid bidra til tilstander som biceps tendinopati eller AC-ledd-artrose.

 

 
 
 45%
 av kontorarbeidere har nakke/skulderplager
 

 
 7+ timer
 gjennomsnittlig PC-tid per dag
 

 
 20 min
 maksimal tid i samme stilling

Causes of Dizziness - From Most to Least Common

 

 Here are the main causes, sorted by how often they occur:

 
 
 BPPV (Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo)

 17-42% of cases
 

 Go to full article on BPPV →

 BPPV is the most common cause of dizziness investigated in clinics (Bosner, BMC Fam Pract, 2018). The
 condition occurs when small calcium crystals detach from their place in the balance organ and end up in
 the semicircular canals.

 Characteristics:

 
 Short, intense spinning attacks (10-60 seconds)

 Triggered by specific head movements - turning in bed, looking up, bending down

 Nausea during attacks

 Symptom-free between attacks

 
 

 
 
 Vestibular Migraine

 approx. 1-3% of population
 

 Go to full article on
 vestibular migraine →

 Lifetime prevalence around 1%, but newer American data suggests up to 2.7% (Formeister, Otol Neurotol,
 2018). The Barany Society has identified this as "by far the most common cause" of combined neck pain
 and vestibular symptoms. Can occur with or without headache.

 

 
 
 Vestibular Neuritis

 3-10% in dizziness clinics
 

 Go to full article on
 vestibular neuritis →

 Annual incidence of 3.5-7 per 100,000 (Iwasaki, Auris Nasus Larynx, 2024). Accounts for 3-10% of
 diagnoses in specialised dizziness clinics. Viral inflammation of the balance nerve causing sudden,
 intense dizziness over several days. Hearing is not affected. 10-15% develop BPPV afterwards.

 Contraindicated Measures

 
 HVLA neck manipulation

 Neck mobilization with end-range movements

 Mechanical neck traction

 Aggressive mobility exercises for the neck

Smale BH-stropper

 Forskning fra University of Wollongong (2015) viser at brede stropper (4,5 cm) reduserer topptrykket med ca. 35% sammenlignet med standard 2,5 cm stropper.

 

 Andre faktorer

 
 Lang daglig brukstid: De fleste kvinner bruker BH 12-14 timer daglig. Trykk på bare 9 kPa over 2 timer kan gi hud- og muskelskade.

 Dårlig holdning: Avrundede skuldre Øker belastningen på stroppene og kan forsterke kompresjonen.

 Racerback-BHer: Samler stroppene nårmere nakken og kan Øke trykket på sensitive områder.

 
 

 
 
 
 3
 Symptomer

 

 Det typiske symptombildet har et karakteristisk mønster:

 
 Typiske symptomer

 
 Skulder- og nakkesmerter - ofte på begge sider, men kan våre verre på en side

 Smertene er minimale om morgenen og blir gradvis verre utover dagen

 Lindring når BH-en fjernes - dette er et viktig diagnostisk tegn

 Nummenhet eller prikking ned i armen (på grunn av nervekompresjon)

 Synlige furer eller merker der stroppene sitter

 Hodepine - ofte fra bakhodet og oppover

 Tretthet i skuldrene, spesielt ved langvarig stående eller børing av vesker

Describe What is BPPV (Crystal Disease)? for Dizzy When Lying Down? What You Need to Know About BPPV.

What is BPPV (Crystal Disease)?

 

 The condition is benign - it is not caused by serious illness - but can be very bothersome and significantly affect daily life.

 
 How common is it?

 BPPV affects around 2.4% of the population during their lifetime. In Norway, this corresponds to approximately 80,000 new cases each year. The condition is most common in people over 50 years old, and women are affected twice as often as men.

 By age 80, up to 10% of the population has experienced at least one episode. A Norwegian registry study showed that dizziness accounts for nearly 1% of all long-term sick leave.

 Vanligvis ikke nødvendig, men kan brukes ved usikkerhet

Behandling

 Behandlingen tilpasses fasen du er i. Målet er å lindre smerte, bevare og gjenvinne bevegelighet, og støtte den naturlige helingsprosessen.

 Konservativ behandling (førstevalg)

 Fase 1 (Frysefasen) - Fokus på smertelindring

 Smertestillende/betennelsesdempende ved behov

 Skånsom bevegelse innenfor smertetoleranse

 Unngå aggressiv tøyning

 Varme kan lindre

 Fase 2 (Frossen fase) - Fokus på bevegelighet

 Gradvis økende bevegelighetsøvelser

 Mobilisering hos kiropraktor/fysioterapeut

 Pendeløvelser og passive tøyninger

 Styrketrening innenfor smertefritt utslag

 Fase 3 (Tinefasen) - Fokus på funksjon

 Progressiv bevegelighetstrening

 Styrketrening for rotatormansjetten

 Gradvis tilbake til normale aktiviteter

 Vedlikeholdsøvelser

 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 Mobilisering: Skånsom behandling for å bevare og øke bevegelighet

 Bløtvevsbehandling: Arbeid med stram muskulatur rundt skulderen

 Øvelsesveiledning: Tilpasset fase og toleranse

 Nakke/rygg: Behandle kompenserende spenninger

 Oppfølging: Veilede gjennom de ulike fasene

 Injeksjonsbehandling

 Kortisoninjeksjon

 Kan gi god smertelindring, spesielt i frysefasen. Effekten er ofte midlertidig (uker til måneder), men kan gjøre det lettere å komme i gang med øvelser. Les mer om kortison i skulderen .

 Hydrodilatation

 Injeksjon av væske i leddet for å «sprenge» opp kapselen. Kan vurderes i utvalgte tilfeller. Forskningen viser varierende resultater.

 Kirurgisk behandling

 Vurderes kun ved langvarige, behandlingsresistente tilfeller
 Artroskopisk kapselløsning

 Kikkhullskirurgi hvor kirurgen klipper i den stramme kapselen. Aktuelt hos pasienter som ikke responderer på konservativ behandling etter lang tid (typisk 6-12 måneder uten bedring).

 Manipulasjon under narkose

 Skulderen beveges gjennom hele utslaget under narkose for å løsne adhesjonene. Brukes sjeldnere nå på grunn av risiko for komplikasjoner.

Hvorfor Øvelser Hjelper ved Isjias

Describe How the Balance System Gets Involved for The Connection Between Jaw, Neck and Dizziness.

How the Balance System Gets Involved

 

 The balance system (the vestibular system) also has direct connections to the upper neck. The same cervical vertebrae that participate in the trigeminocervical complex send proprioceptive signals (position sense) directly to the balance nuclei in the brainstem.

 The suboccipital muscles (the small muscles at the top of the neck) have the highest concentration of position sense cells in the entire body - 242 muscle spindles per gram compared to only 2.2 per gram in the trapezius.

 When these muscles are tense or dysfunctional, signals to the brain can become disturbed. The result is a sensory mismatch - the brain receives conflicting information from eyes, ears, and neck, and this is experienced as dizziness.

Explain prevention for Overtraining and Overuse.

Prevention

 Prevention is far easier than treatment. With a few concrete strategies, you can train hard and smart without crossing the line.

 Periodization

 Vary training load systematically. Use a 3:1 model as a starting point – three weeks of gradually increasing load, followed by a lighter recovery week. During the recovery week, reduce volume by 40-60% but maintain intensity on some sessions. Plan your season with building blocks, not as a straight line upward.

 The 10% rule

 Do not increase total training load (volume, intensity, or frequency) by more than 10% per week. This applies especially to runners and endurance athletes. When starting after a break, begin at 50-60% of your previous level and build up gradually.

 Monitoring

 Daily: Subjective well-being (sleep 1-5, energy 1-5, mood 1-5, muscle stiffness 1-5)

 Daily: Resting heart rate in the morning (lying down, before getting up)

 Weekly: HRV trend (use 7-day average, not individual measurements)

 Each session: RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion) – perceived effort 1-10

 Monthly: Performance test in your sport (e.g., 5 km running test, benchmark WOD)

 Sleep

 Sleep is the most important recovery tool you have. Halson (2014) documents that sleep deprivation reduces glycogen replenishment, increases cortisol, inhibits muscle protein synthesis, and weakens the immune system. Aim for at least 8 hours for athletes, consider 9-10 hours during intensive training periods. A consistent bedtime and wake time is more important than total duration.

 Nutrition

 Energy availability: Minimum 45 kcal/kg fat-free mass per day for athletes. Below 30 kcal/kg markedly increases the risk of REDs

 Carbohydrates: 5-12 g/kg body weight per day depending on training intensity. Most important around training sessions

 Protein: 1.6-2.2 g/kg per day, distributed across 4-5 meals.

Beskriv diagnostikk for Isjias: Alt du trenger å vite.

Diagnostikk

 Klinisk undersøkelse

 Diagnostikken baseres primært på sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse. En grundig nevrologisk undersøkelse kan ofte lokalisere hvilket niva i ryggen som er affisert.

 Lasegues test (straight leg raise) er den mest prediktive testen for å identifisere kandidater for kirurgi. Testen er positiv når den reproduserer pasientens smerte ved et benløft under 45 grader med utstraling under kneet (StatPearls, 2023).

 Bildediagnostikk

 MR eller CT anbefales ikke rutinemessig . Danske nasjonale retningslinjer frarader rutinemessig bildediagnostikk ved nyoppstått isjias (European Spine Journal, 2018).

 Viktig å forstå

 Bildediagnostikk viser ofte normalfunn som slitasje og degenerative forandringer som ikke forklarer smerten. Studier viser at opptil 20-80% av symptomfrie personer har funn på MR som diskusbuling, degenerasjon eller protrusion (StatPearls, 2023).

 Bildediagnostikk er indisert ved
 Mistanke om alvorlig patologi ( røde flagg )

 Vedvarende symptomer etter 6-8 ukers konservativ behandling

 Ved vurdering av kirurgi

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for FAI - Hip Impingement.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 What is the difference between cam and pincer?

 Cam FAI is caused by a bump on the femoral head impinging
 against the socket. Pincer FAI is caused by the socket extending too far out. Cam is
 most common in men, pincer in women. most have a combination (mixed type).

 

 
 Does FAI need surgery?

 No, most people with FAI do not need surgery. The UK FASHIoN
 study showed that physical therapy was almost as effective as surgery after 12
 months. Surgery is considered only after 3-6 months without sufficient improvement
 from conservative treatment.

 

 
 Can I continue to exercise?

 Yes, but with modifications. Avoid exercises that cause pain,
 especially deep squats and extreme hip positions. Many activities can continue with
 modifications. Hip strength training is actually important for improvement.

 

 
 Will FAI lead to osteoarthritis?

 FAI is a risk factor for hip
 osteoarthritis, but most do not develop osteoarthritis. Good muscle strength
 and control can reduce risk. It is unclear if treatment prevents osteoarthritis
 long-term.

 

 
 Why did I get FAI?

 FAI morphology typically develops in adolescence during bone
 growth. Genetics play a role, and intensive sports in adolescence (especially
 soccer, hockey, dance) can affect hip shape. It's not something you "did wrong".
