Describe How Common Are Foot Problems? for Foot and Ankle Problems.

How Common Are Foot Problems?

 

 A systematic review from 2011 analysed 31 studies with over 75,000 participants and found that
 24% of adults over 45 report frequent foot problems, and 15% have ankle
 problems. Prevalence increases with age, and women are affected more often than men.

 A large population study from North England found that foot problems in people over 55 double the
 risk of difficulties with standing and walking, and increase the risk of problems with stairs
 by 71%.

 Common Symptoms

 
 Morning stiffness: Pain and stiffness with first steps after rest

 Load-related pain: Worsening with standing, walking or running

 Swelling: Localised or diffuse around foot or ankle

 Instability: Feeling the ankle "gives way"

 Numbness or tingling: In toes or forefoot

Beskriv Løperen: Når pusten blir begrenset for Slik å delegger en stiv rygg for golfsvingen og tennisserven din.

Løperen: Når pusten blir begrenset

 

 Hyperkyfose - overdreven krumning av brystryggen - påvirker ikke bare bevegelse, men også pustekapasiteten. Les mer om sammenhengen mellom pust, stress og rygg. Framingham-studien, som fulgte deltakere over 16 Ør, fant at kvinner med uttalt kyfose hadde målbart større nedgang i lungefunksjon over tid sammenlignet med de med normal holdning (Lorbergs et al., 2017).

 For utøvere med alvorlig hyperkyfose (over 75 grader) - som kan sees ved Scheuermanns sykdom - viste en studie av Barrios et al. (2019) at VO2max - et mål på maksimal oksygenopptak - var signifikant lavere enn hos kontrollgruppen. Dette kan direkte påvirke utholdenhet og prestasjon.

 
 Holdning påvirker pustefunksjon

 En fersk studie fra 2025 (Chiba et al., Cureus) testet effekten av simulert kyfotisk holdning under løping. Selv hos friske unge menn Økte respirasjonsbelastningen målbart - høyere karbondioksidproduksjon og respirasjonskvotient - selv om oksygenforbruket var likt.

Differential diagnoses for Calcific Tendinitis: Everything You Need to Know?

 the conditions.

Impingement syndrome

 Overlapping symptoms with painful arc. Calcific tendinitis can cause secondary impingement.

AC joint arthritis 

 Pain localized more to the top of the shoulder. X-ray shows changes in the AC joint, not calcium in

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain evidence-based treatment for Hallux Valgus.

Evidence-Based Treatment

 Conservative treatment is the first choice and is effective for most people. The goal is pain relief,
 slowing progression, and maintaining function.

 Gold Standard: Conservative Treatment First

 80-90% of patients with hallux valgus achieve satisfactory pain relief with conservative measures.
 Surgery is reserved for cases with significant pain and functional impairment after failed conservative
 treatment.

 Conservative Measures

 1

 Proper Footwear

 Shoes with wide toe box and low heel. Avoid pointed shoes and heels over 2-3 cm. This is the most
 important single measure.

 2

 Toe Spreaders

 Provide pain relief and better toe separation during use. Start gradually with short periods. Does
 not permanently change the deformity but can slow progression.

 3

 Strengthening Exercises for Foot Muscles

 Strengthening of abductor hallucis and intrinsic foot muscles. "Toe yoga", towel gathering with
 toes, and foot arch activation.

 4

 Manual Treatment

 Joint mobilization of the MTP joint and midfoot. Soft tissue techniques for tight muscles. Can
 improve mobility and reduce pain.

 5

 Protective Padding

 Gel padding over the protruding joint to reduce friction and pain in shoes.

Explain Sitting Posture and Back Pain to a patient.

The average person spends 8-9 hours per day sitting. Office workers often even more. Many believe the solution is a "perfect sitting posture" with a straight back, shoulders pulled back, and chin tucked in. Research tells a different story: there is no perfect posture.

 Pain researcher Peter O'Sullivan established already in 2012 that postural correction alone has little effect on back pain (JOSPT, 2012). The best sitting posture is simply the next one - the body is designed for movement, not stillness.

Describe symptoms and signs of Flat Back (Hypokyphosis).

Symptoms - More Than Just Back Pain

 

 What makes hypokyphosis and especially Straight Back Syndrome challenging are the symptoms that can be
 confused with heart disease.

 A classic study by Davies et al. (Quarterly Journal of Medicine, 1980) documented the symptom profile:
 

 
 Palpitations: 38% of patients (most common symptom)

 Chest pain: 29%

 Breathing difficulty: 19%

 

 Chest pain and "heart anxiety"

 When the chest cavity lacks the normal curvature, space is reduced. The heart can be pressed against the
 sternum, and this can cause pain resembling angina (heart cramp). In some cases, ECG may show changes
 resembling a heart attack, even when the heart is healthy (Shiba & Kenzaka, Internal Medicine Case Reports
 Journal, 2022).

 Connection with heart valve problems

 A striking finding is that 58-67% of patients with Straight Back Syndrome have concurrent mitral valve
 prolapse (Davies, 1980; Ansari, Clinical Cardiology, 1985). Of these, a significant proportion (77% in one
 series) later require heart surgery.

 Breathing problems

 A flat thoracic spine reduces chest mobility. The ribs need the curvature to rotate optimally during
 inhalation, and problems here can resemble rib lock. Lung function tests may
 show reduced capacity - one case report documented over 2 liters improvement in lung capacity after
 treatment that increased the kyphosis angle by 10 degrees (PMC, 2017). Read more about the connection
 between breathing, stress and back.

 Musculoske...

Hva er meralgia paresthetica?: Meralgia paresthetica (MP) er en tilstand der den laterale femorale kutannerven blir klemt eller irritert. Dette gir brennende smerte, nummenhet eller prikking på utsiden av læret. Tilstanden er en av flere årsaker til hoftesmerter som kan behandles konservativt.

Symptomer: Meralgia paresthetica gir ingen svakhet i benet. Hvis du har svakhet i lar eller hofte, kommer symptomene sannsynligvis fra ryggen eller en annen nerve. Isjias gir symptomer på baksiden av benet, ikke fremsiden. Smerter på utsiden av hoften kan også skyldes GTPS/gluteal tendinopati , mens smerter dypt i setet kan tyde på piriformis syndrom .

Diagnostikk: Diagnosen stilles vanligvis på bakgrunn av sykehistorie og klinisk undersøkelse . Bildediagnostikk er sjelden nødvendig.

Behandling: 85% blir bra med enkle tiltak rettet mot utløsende årsak.

Prognose: Prognosen for meralgia paresthetica er svært god.

Beskriv Myten om ergonomi for Musearm og kontorplager: Hva som faktisk virker.

Myten om ergonomi

 

 Her kommer den overraskende sannheten: ergonomi alene har ikke sterk evidens for å forebygge eller behandle musearm.

 
 Hva forskningen viser

 Systematiske oversikter (Cochrane) har gjennomgått all tilgjengelig forskning og konkluderer:

 
 Ergonomiske tilpasninger alene har ikke tilstrekkelig evidens for effekt

 Ergonomisk utstyr (mus, tastatur, stoler) gir ikke dokumentert bedring i symptomer

 Kombinasjonen av ergonomi + trening gir bedre resultater enn ergonomi alene

 
 

 Dette betyr ikke at ergonomi er uvesentlig - det betyr at du trenger mer enn bare ergonomi.

Assess red flags: 6-year-old boy, limping for 3 weeks, hip pain, refuses to bear weight, low-grade fever, elevated CRP.

RED FLAGS IDENTIFIED: Possible septic arthritis or Legg-Calvé-Perthes disease.

Findings:
- Child with persistent limp (>2 weeks)
- Weight-bearing refusal
- Low-grade fever with elevated CRP
- Insidious onset

ACTION: Urgent pediatric referral. Hip X-ray and MRI. Blood cultures if septic arthritis suspected. Septic arthritis is a surgical emergency requiring joint washout. Do NOT delay for conservative trial. Legg-Calvé-Perthes also requires orthopedic management.

Behandling

 

 Dette er det viktigste budskapet: 75-90% av pasienter med nakkeprolaps og radikulopati blir betydelig bedre uten operasjon. Danske nasjonale retningslinjer fra 2017 anbefaler manuell behandling kombinert med Øvelser som førstevalg, får medisiner vurderes.

 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 En systematisk oversikt fra 2021 fant at manuell behandling viste effekt i alle inkluderte studier, uavhengig av teknikk. Konsensus er at kombinasjonen av manuell terapi og Øvelser gir bedre resultater enn hver behandling alene.

 
 Behandlingen kan inkludere:

 
 Leddmobilisering av nakkevirvler og Øvre rygg

 Bløtvevsbehandling av stram muskulatur i nakke og skulder

 Nevral mobilisering (forsiktig bevegelse av nerven i sitt forløp)

 Øvelsesinstruksjon - styrke og stabilitet, særlig dype nakkebøyere

 Ergonomisk veiledning og tilpasning av arbeidsstilling

 
 

 Hva kan du gjøre selv?

 
 Hold deg i aktivitet - unngå langvarig sengeleie

 Øvelser - gjør de Øvelsene du får av behandler regelmessig

 Ergonomi - juster skjerm, stol og arbeidsstilling

 Sovepute - en støttende pute som holder nakken i nøytral stilling

 Varme eller kulde - prøv deg frem med hva som gir best lindring

 

 Behandlingsforløp

 
 Akutt fase (0-4 uker): 2-3 behandlinger per uke, fokus på smertelindring og bevegelighet

 Rehabiliteringsfase (4-12 uker): 1-2 behandlinger per uke, Økende fokus på egenØvelser og funksjon

Provide a structured clinical overview of Overtraining and Overuse.

From hard training to overtraining – a spectrum: Overtraining is not a switch that suddenly flips on. It is a spectrum where the body gradually loses its ability to recover. The European College of Sport Science (ECSS) and the American College of Sports Medicine (ACSM) divide this spectrum into three levels
Symptoms – body and mind: Overtraining syndrome is a systemic condition that affects the entire body. Symptoms can be subtle at first but gradually become more prominent.

Causes – more than just too much training: Overtraining is rarely the result of training alone. It is the sum of all stress the body is exposed to, combined with insufficient recovery. Think of it as a balance sheet: on one side you have load, on the other you have healing.

REDs – when the body runs out of fuel: Relative Energy Deficiency in Sport (REDs), updated by the IOC in 2023, describes the consequences of expending more energy than you consume over time. REDs is not an eating disorder – it can just as easily be caused by lack of awareness about energy needs, or by training volume increasing without a corresponding increase in food intake.

Diagnosis – difficult, but possible: There is no single blood test or examination that confirms overtraining syndrome. OTS is a diagnosis of exclusion – you must first rule out other causes such as anemia, hypothyroidism, infections, depression, diabetes, and other medical conditions that can produce similar symptoms.

Treatment – rest first: There is no shortcut out of overtraining syndrome. The fundamental treatment is simple in theory but challenging in practice: reduced load and increased recovery . Treatment typically follows three phases.

Prevention: Prevention is far easier than treatment. With a few concrete strategies, you can train hard and smart without crossing the line.

The chiropractor's role in overuse injuries: As a chiropractor, I regularly see patients who have pushed their bodies too hard for too long.

Provide a structured clinical overview of Jumper's Knee.

What is Jumper's Knee?: Jumper's knee (patellar tendinopathy) is an overuse injury in the patellar tendon - the tendon that
 connects the kneecap to the shinbone. The condition is also called "jumper's knee." Unlike runner's knee (PFPS) which affects the joint itself, here it's the tendon
 that's the problem.

Symptoms: Acute response to overload. The tendon swells and thickens. Often after sudden training increase.

Treatment - Heavy Slow Resistance: Exercise-based treatment is the cornerstone for tendon problems. Heavy Slow Resistance (HSR) has proven
 at least as effective as eccentric training.

What You Should AVOID: If your doctor suggests a cortisone injection for tendon problems, ask about
 alternatives!

Prognosis: Tendon problems require patience. Expect 3-6 months of rehabilitation for good effect.

Forklar Hodepine Etter Nakkesleng for en pasient.

Post-traumatisk hodepine (PTH) er hodepine som utvikler seg etter en skade mot hode eller nakke. Ved nakkesleng (whiplash) skjer dette typisk etter en akselerasjon-deselerasjon-mekanisme - som ved påkjørsel bakfra, fall eller idrettsskader.

 Mellom 30-90% av alle som får nakkesleng utvikler hodepine i akuttfasen (Al-Khazali et al., 2020). En meta-analyse fra 2023 viste at 47% fortsatt har hodepine ett år etter skaden (Herrero Babiloni et al., Pain 2023).

Er H81.9 en ICPC-2 kode?

Nei. H81.9 er ICD-10 for uspesifisert vestibulær forstyrrelse.

Riktig ICPC-2 kode er H82 — Vertigo-syndrom. H82 dekker vestibulære lidelser i ICPC-2.

Beskriv typer hormonrelatert hodepine for Hormonhodepine og menstruell migrene.

Typer hormonrelatert hodepine

 Ren menstruell migrene

 7-14% av migrenekvinner 

 Migreneanfall som kun oppstår i forbindelse med menstruasjon (dag -2 til +3 i syklus). Ingen anfall på andre tidspunkter. Kjennetegnes ofte av lengre varighet og dårligere respons på triptaner enn vanlig migrene .

 Menstruasjonsrelatert migrene

 Vanligst - ca. 50% 

 Migreneanfall som ofte kommer rundt menstruasjon, men som også oppstår på andre tidspunkter i syklus. Det må være en tydelig økning i anfallsfrekvens rundt mensen for å kvalifisere.

 Hormonhodepine ved p-piller

 Hodepine som oppstår i den pillefrie uken når østrogennivået faller. Kan også oppleves ved oppstårt eller bytte av prevensjon.

 Hormonhodepine i overgangsalderen

 Uforutsigbare hormonsvingninger i perimenopause kan gi uregelmessig hodepine. Mange opplever forverring i denne fasen, men bedring etter menopause. Noen utvikler kronisk daglig hodepine i denne perioden.

 Hvordan vite om du har menstruell migrene?

 For hodepinedagbok i minst 3 måneder og noter anfallsdager samt menstruasjonsdatoer. Et tydelig mønster der anfall konsekvent oppstår dag -2 til +3 i syklus støtter diagnosen.

Explain coordination exercises - strongest evidence for Jaw Exercises and Home Treatment for TMD.

Coordination Exercises - Strongest Evidence

 Coordination exercises show the most suitable effect according to systematic review (Shimada et al., 2023). These exercises train the jaw to move controlled and symmetrically.

 Controlled Opening and Closing

 Place the tip of your tongue against the palate, just behind the front teeth

 Open your mouth slowly while keeping the tongue in place

 Stop when the tongue begins to release from the palate

 Close slowly back

 Repeat 6-10 times, 3-6 times daily

Explain what does new research say about treatment? for Concussion in Sports: When Can You Play Again?.

What does new research say about treatment?

 End of the "cocoon" approach

 The Amsterdam Consensus Statement from 2023 - the most comprehensive review of concussion research ever (78,000 studies evaluated) - turns old practice upside down.

 Previous vs. new recommendation

 Previous recommendation: Complete rest from all physical and cognitive activity until symptom-free.

 New recommendation: 24-48 hours of relative rest, then gradual return to light aerobic activity. Strict rest ("cocooning") is not beneficial and may actually prolong recovery.

 A randomized study with 103 adolescents showed that those who started controlled exercise early recovered in a median of 13 days, compared to 17 days for the group that only rested. Prolonged recovery over 30 days affected only 4% in the exercise group versus 14% in the rest group.

Explain prevention for Runner's Knee.

Prevention

 If you've had runner's knee once, the risk of recurrence is higher. Prevention is therefore important
 The 10% rule

 Never increase weekly training volume by more than 10% at a time. This applies to both distance and
 intensity.

 Maintenance training

 Weekly strength program

 2-3 times per week with hip exercises

 Maintain hip strength throughout the running season

 Include single-leg exercises

 Don't drop strength training when things are going well!

 Variety

 Vary surfaces (asphalt, gravel, forest)

 Include easy days in your program

 Cross-training (cycling, swimming) is beneficial

Hvorfor nakkeøvelser er viktig

 Nakken er avhengig av et finstemt samspill mellom dype stabilisatorer og overfladiske bevegelsesmuskler. Ved nakkesmerter skjer det fire velkjente endringer i dette systemet
 Hva skjer i nakken ved smerte?

 Hemming av dype fleksorer: Longus colli og longus capitis blir svakere og mindre aktive

 Overaktivering av overfladiske muskler: Øvre trapezius og SCM kompenserer, noe som gir spenning og utmattelse

 Redusert propriosepsjon: Nakken mister noe av sin stillingssans

 Endret bevegelsesmønster: Bevegelsene blir stivere og mer vaktsomme

 Målrettet trening adresserer alle fire mekanismene. En Cochrane-oversikt viser en standardisert gjennomsnittlig forskjell på -0,71 for smerteintensitet med styrketrening sammenlignet med kontroll, som tilsvarer ca. 10-15 % smerteintensitetsreduksjon (Gross 2015).

 73 % 
 smertereduksjon med styrketrening (Ylinen 2003) 

 6 uker 
 minimum for målbar effekt 

 10 min 
 daglig er tilstrekkelig 

 JOSPT publiserte i 2023 en systematisk oversikt som konkluderer med at øvelser sannsynligvis reduserer risikoen for nye nakkesmerteepisoder på kort sikt. Regelmessig trening er derfor viktig både for behandling og forebygging.

Patient asks: "What is the difference between carpal tunnel syndrome and cervical radiculopathy?"

Carpal tunnel syndrome is caused by compression of the median nerve in the wrist and causes numbness in
                thumb, index and middle finger. Cervical radiculopathy is caused by nerve root involvement in the neck
                and often causes radiation from neck down into arm, along with numbness in a dermatome pattern.

Diagnostikk

 Diagnosen stilles primært gjennom klinisk undersøkelse. Sykehistorien er ofte avslærende: smerter som varierer med BH-bruk, synlige stropp-furer, og bedring i helger eller ferier når pasienten bruker BH mindre.

 Differensialdiagnoser som må vurderes

 Tilstand 
 Kjennetegn 
 Skiller seg ved 

 Cervikal radikulopati 
 Typisk ensidig, følger dermatom 
 Positiv Spurlings test, refleksforandringer 

 Thoracic outlet syndrom / T4-syndrom 
 Lignende symptomer, ofte ensidig 
 Ingen synlige stropp-furer, vaskulære symptomer 

 Rotatorcuff-problemer 
 Smertebue, svakhet ved visse bevegelser 
 Positive impingement-tester, smerter ved aktive bevegelser 

 Om bildediagnostikk

 MR og røntgen er sjelden nødvendig for BH-stropp-syndrom. Disse undersøkelsene viser ofte "normalfunn" som slitasjeforandringer som ikke forklarer smertene. Den kliniske undersøkelsen - med fokus på stropp-furer, symptommønster og respons på BH-fjerning - er viktigere enn bilder.

Patient asks: "How do I know if my rib is broken or just dislocated?"

The most important clue is the trauma history. With a fracture, you remember
 exactly what happened - a fall, a blow, an accident. With dislocation, the history is often more vague.
 The intensity is also different - fractures typically cause more intense pain that makes it difficult to
 take deep breaths. A clinical examination can usually distinguish between the conditions.

Describe diagnosis for POTS and Orthostatic Dizziness.

Diagnosis

 Diagnostic Criteria (Heart Rhythm Society 2015)

 To receive a POTS diagnosis, you must meet
 Pulse increase of >=30 beats/min (>=40 for ages 12-19) within 10 minutes of standing

 Or pulse over 120 beats/min when standing

 Absence of orthostatic hypotension (blood pressure drop >=20 mmHg)

 Symptoms have lasted more than 3 months

 No other condition that explains the symptoms

 Active Standing Test (can be done in clinic)

 A simple test: You lie flat for 5-10 minutes, pulse and blood pressure are measured, you stand up and stay still, and measurements are taken at 1, 3, 5 and 10 minutes. Pulse increase >=30 without blood pressure drop suggests POTS.

 Red Flags - Seek medical help immediately for
 Chest pain or pressure in the chest

 Severe shortness of breath

 Repeated fainting

 Irregular heartbeat

 Symptoms that worsen rapidly

 Neurological symptoms (vision loss, speech difficulties, one-sided weakness)

 POTS itself is not dangerous, but the symptoms can mimic other conditions that require acute treatment.

Vurder røde flagg: 62 år mann med diabetes type 2. Gradvis nummenhet og prikking i begge føtter siste året. Symmetrisk. Nedsatt vibrasjonssans distalt. Normale reflekser. Normal gange. Strømpelignende distribusjon.

HASTEGRAD: TRYGT

Ingen røde flagg identifisert.

Klinisk resonnering — hvorfor bilateral fotnummenhet IKKE er myelopati/CES:
- Symmetrisk, distal, strømpelignende distribusjon = klassisk PERIFER polynevropati
- Diabetes type 2 = vanligste årsak til perifer nevropati
- Myelopati/CES: nummenhet i SADELANESTESI-område (perineum), ofte med motorisk svakhet
- Perifer nevropati: starter distalt (tær/føtter), beveger seg proksimalt gradvis
- Nedsatt vibrasjonssans = tidlig tegn på perifer nevropati (store fibre)
- Normale reflekser og normal gange = ingen øvre motornevron-patologi

Klinisk bilde: Diabetisk perifer polynevropati.

Trygt å behandle muskuloskeletalt. Henvis til fastlege for HbA1c-kontroll og nevropati-oppfølging.

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain treatment for Thoracic Disc Herniation.

Treatment

 What Can the Chiropractor Do?

 The chiropractor's primary role in thoracic disc herniation is differential diagnosis -
 identifying the condition and assessing severity.

 Evidence Base

 There are no randomized controlled trials (RCTs) examining chiropractic or manual treatment
 specifically for thoracic disc herniation (ScienceDirect, 2006). Published case reports document serious
 complications after manipulation with known thoracic herniation (JAMA Neurology, 1987).

 For confirmed herniation without myelopathy, gentle soft tissue treatment and mobilization of surrounding
 areas may potentially relieve muscular compensation pain. High-velocity manipulation should be
 avoided when disc pathology in the thoracic spine is suspected.

 With signs of myelopathy or progressive neurological deficits, the patient should be referred
 immediately. 

 Conservative Treatment Generally

 For patients without myelopathy, conservative treatment is recommended as first choice
 Rest and activity modification: Short rest period (1-2 days) followed by gradual
 increase in activity

 Medication: Anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) after medical evaluation

 Physical therapy: Structured treatment for 4-6 weeks

 About 80% of patients return to previous activity level with conservative treatment
 (StatPearls, 2024). The classic study by Brown et al. (1992) followed 55 patients - 73% never needed
 surgery.

 Surgery

 Surgery is reserved for
 Progressive myelopathy or neurological deficits

 Large herniations (>40-50% canal narrowing)

 Persistent symptoms after 6-12 weeks of conservative treatment

 Newer posterolateral surgical techniques show complication rate of 12.4% and neurological worsening in
 3.5% (JOSR, 2023).

Differential diagnoses for You Don't Have to Live With Dizziness Anymore?

BPPV - Vertigo

 BPPV (benign paroxysmal positional vertigo) is the most common cause of rotational dizziness and accounts for 17-42% of all dizziness cases. The condition occurs when small calcium particles dislodge in the inner ear and end up in the semicircular canals.

 Typical characteristics: Brief, intense dizziness episodes (seconds to one minute) triggered by head movements - such as turning in bed, bending down, or looking up.

 Treatment response: Studies show 80-90% improvement with repositioning maneuvers like Epley. Many experience improvement after one treatment, while others need 2-3 treatments. Success rate after repeated treatments is over 90-95%.

Cervicogenic Dizziness (Neck-Related)

 Studies show that up to 40% of patients with neck pain also experience dizziness. The upper cervical vertebrae (C1-C3) contain a high concentration of position sense receptors that send information to the brain about head position. When these signals are disturbed, the result can be unsteadiness and dizziness.

 Typical characteristics: Persistent unsteadiness that worsens with neck movements, often combined with neck pain and headache.

 Treatment response: A systematic review from 2011 concluded that there is moderate evidence for manual treatment of cervicogenic dizziness. Treatment is often combined with specific exercises.

Vestibular Neuritis

 An inflammation of the balance nerve, often after a viral infection. Causes sudden, intense dizziness that lasts for days to weeks.

 Treatment response: Vestibular rehabilitation shows significant effect. A Cochrane review found statistically significant improvement compared to no treatment.

Other Causes

 Vestibular migraine, Meniere's disease, medication side effects, and orthostatic hypotension (blood pressure drop when standing) are among other common causes. Sometimes multiple conditions overlap.

Describe The Runner: When Breathing Becomes Limited for How a Stiff Back Ruins Your Golf Swing and Tennis Serve.

The Runner: When Breathing Becomes Limited

 

 Hyperkyphosis - excessive curvature of the thoracic spine - affects not only movement but also breathing
 capacity. Learn more about the connection between breathing, stress,
 and back. The Framingham Study, which followed participants over 16 years, found that women with
 pronounced kyphosis had measurably greater decline in lung function over time compared to those with
 normal posture (Lorbergs et al., 2017).

 For athletes with severe hyperkyphosis (over 75 degrees) - as seen in Scheuermann's disease - a study by Barrios et al. (2019) showed
 that VO2max - a measure of maximum oxygen uptake - was significantly lower than in the
 control group. This can directly affect endurance and performance.

 
 Posture Affects Breathing Function

 A recent study from 2025 (Chiba et al., Cureus) tested the effect of simulated kyphotic posture during
 running. Even in healthy young men, respiratory load increased measurably - higher carbon dioxide
 production and respiratory quotient - even though oxygen consumption was the same.

Beskriv Pust, stress og det autonome nervesystemet for Pust, Stress og Rygg.

Pust, stress og det autonome nervesystemet

 

 Sympatisk aktivering fra brystryggen

 Det sympatiske nervesystemet - den delen som styrer "kamp eller flukt"-responsen - har sine nerveknutepunkter langs brystryggen fra T1 til T12. Dette har ført til teorier om at stivhet i brystryggen kan "irritere" disse strukturene og bidra til kronisk stressaktivering. Ved T4-syndrom sees ofte autonome symptomer.

 
 Her må man imidlertid våre Årlige om evidensen

 Den mest omfattende gjennomgangen (Kovanur Sampath et al., 2024) analyserte 14 studier med 618 deltakere og konkluderte med at det finnes lav kvalitet på evidens for at ryggmanipulasjon påvirker det autonome nervesystemet. Målinger av hjerteratevariabilitet, blodtrykk og stresshormoner viste ingen konsistent effekt.

 Det betyr ikke at koblingen mellom holdning og stress er innbilt - bare at mekanismen sannsynligvis er mer kompleks enn direkte nervestimulering.

 

 Hyperventilasjon og utmattelse

 En studie fra Karolinska Instituttet (Ristiniemi et al., 2014) fant en sterk sammenheng mellom hyperventilasjon og utmattelsessyndrom (r=0,77). Personer med utmattelse hadde betydelig høyere skØr på Nijmegen-spårreskjemaet for hyperventilasjon (26,57 vs. 15,14 hos friske).

 Dette samsvarer med klinisk erfaring: Kronisk stress endrer pustemønsteret, som igjen forverrer stressresponsen.

Beskriv symptomer for Meralgia Paresthetica.

Symptomer

 Typiske symptomer

 Brennende smerte på utsiden av læret

 Nummenhet - nedsatt følelse i huden

 Prikking eller stikking - "maur som kryper"

 Hyperestesi - overfølsomhet, vondt ved lett berøring

 Symptomer i et avgrenset område - ca. 15x20 cm på læret

 Viktige kjennetegn

 Kun følelsessymptomer - aldri muskelsvakhet

 Ensidig - rammer vanligvis bare ett lær (hos 80%)

 Forverres ved standing/gang - bedres ved å sitte

 Ingen rygg- eller lyskesmerter 

 Symptomene forverres ved
 Lang standing

 Lengre gange

 Hofteekstensjon (strekke hoften bakover)

 Stramme bukser eller belte

 Ligge på magen

 Symptomene bedres ved
 Sitte - spesielt med bøyd hofte

 Løse klær

 Bøye hoften fremover

 Hvordan skille fra andre tilstander?

 Meralgia paresthetica gir ingen svakhet i benet. Hvis du har svakhet i lar eller hofte, kommer symptomene sannsynligvis fra ryggen eller en annen nerve. Isjias gir symptomer på baksiden av benet, ikke fremsiden. Smerter på utsiden av hoften kan også skyldes GTPS/gluteal tendinopati , mens smerter dypt i setet kan tyde på piriformis syndrom .

Why Standard Examination Misses These Patients

 Standard examination for BPPV - the Dix-Hallpike test - is typically performed in normal lighting, where the patient can fixate their gaze. This suppresses the characteristic eye movements (nystagmus).

 Examination Conditions 
 Proportion of Nystagmus Detected 

 Normal room lighting 40% 

 Frenzel goggles, light on 66% 

 Frenzel goggles, darkness 83% 

 Videonystagmography (VNG) in darkness 100% 

 Important to Know

 Examination in normal lighting misses about 60% of eye movements that would be visible with proper equipment.

Explain treatment - exercise is key for Knee Osteoarthritis.

Treatment - Exercise is Key

 International guidelines are clear: Exercise is the cornerstone of treatment for knee
 osteoarthritis. 

 First-Line Treatment (Should always be tried first)

 Exercise: Both strength and cardiovascular - at least 3x per week

 Weight loss: If overweight - even 5% can make a big difference

 Education: Understanding the condition reduces fear

 Effective Exercise Types

 Strength training: Quadriceps, hamstrings, hip muscles

 Low-impact cardio: Swimming, cycling, walking

 Balance training: Especially important for fall prevention

 Stretching: Maintains mobility

 Squats 
 Quadriceps strength 

 Lunges 
 Leg stability 

 Step-ups 
 Functional strength 

 Cycling 
 Low-impact cardio 

 Does exercise damage the cartilage?

 No! Research shows that moderate exercise is safe and actually helps maintain the cartilage. The
 cartilage needs loading to stay healthy - it's like a sponge that needs to be squeezed to get
 nutrients.

 Second-Line Treatment

 Paracetamol: Can be tried, limited effect

 NSAIDs: Short-term use if needed (ibuprofen, naproxen)

 Walking aids: Can reduce load

 Braces: Can help some

 What About Injections?

 Cortisone: Short-term effect (weeks), repeated use can damage cartilage

 Hyaluronic acid: Mixed evidence, moderate effect at best

 PRP: Limited evidence, expensive

Cauda Equina Syndrome - Emergency Situation

 

 Cauda equina syndrome (CES) occurs when the nerve bundle at the bottom of the spinal cord becomes
 compressed, usually by a large disc herniation. The condition affects
 approximately 1.6 per 100,000 per year - rare, but very serious.

 
 
 1.6
 per 100,000 per year
 

 
 48h
 critical time window
 

 
 84%
 have bladder symptoms
 

 

 Symptoms to Watch For

 
 Cauda Equina Symptoms

 
 Bladder dysfunction (84%): Difficulty starting urination, weak stream, feeling of
 incomplete emptying, or urinary incontinence

 Saddle anesthesia (71%): Numbness or altered sensation around the rectum, genitals,
 and inner thighs

 Bowel dysfunction (62%): Altered bowel control

 Bilateral leg weakness: Weakness in both legs that develops rapidly

 
 

 
 Why is it urgent?

 Deterioration can occur at approximately 1% per hour. Delay beyond 48 hours was associated with 9.6
 times increased mortality. There is no "safe" waiting time.

Explain treatment for Temporal Arteritis.

Treatment

 Treatment of temporal arteritis is time-critical and long-term . Rapid initiation of corticosteroids is the most important measure to prevent vision loss.

 Treatment starts BEFORE the diagnosis is confirmed

 When there is strong clinical suspicion of temporal arteritis, high-dose corticosteroids should be started immediately - the same day the suspicion arises. You do NOT wait for biopsy, ultrasound, or blood test results. The treatment benefit of early initiation far outweighs the risk of a few days of corticosteroids given to a potentially healthy person.

 Acute treatment: High-dose corticosteroids

 Prednisolone 40-60 mg daily - standard dose for GCA without visual symptoms (EULAR/BSR guidelines)

 Intravenous methylprednisolone 500-1000 mg for 3 days - for vision loss or threatened vision loss, followed by high-dose oral prednisolone

 Dramatic response: Most patients experience significant improvement of headache and constitutional symptoms within 24-72 hours

 Lack of response to corticosteroids should raise doubt about the diagnosis

 Long-term treatment: Gradual tapering

 After the acute phase, the prednisolone dose is gradually tapered over 1-2 years . Tapering is guided by symptoms and inflammatory markers (ESR/CRP). Too rapid tapering carries a high risk of relapse. Some patients require maintenance doses for several years.

 Tocilizumab - corticosteroid-sparing treatment

 Tocilizumab (IL-6 inhibitor) was approved as adjunctive treatment following the landmark GiACTA trial (Stone et al., New England Journal of Medicine 2017). The study showed that tocilizumab combined with corticosteroid tapering resulted in a higher proportion of patients in sustained remission, with a significantly lower total corticosteroid dose. This is particularly beneficial for patients at high risk of corticosteroid side effects.

Diagnostikk

 Diagnosen stilles primært klinisk. To tester er særlig nyttige
 Tinels tegn

 Lett banking over tarsaltunnelen bak den indre ankelen. Positivt når det utløser kribling eller smerte ut i foten. 58-82% sensitivitet - nyttig, men ikke tilstrekkelig alene.

 Dorsalfleksjon-eversjon test

 Ankelen bøyes oppover og dreies utover i 5-10 sekunder. Denne testen har 81,8% sensitivitet og 85,7% spesifisitet - en av de beste kliniske testene for tilstanden (Kinoshita et al. 2001).

 Bildediagnostikk

 Ultralyd er stadig viktigere, særlig for å avdekke ganglioncyster, vaskulære årsaker og hevelse. Kiropraktorer kan rekvirere dette direkte. MR er aktuelt ved mistanke om romoppfyllende prosess.

 Nerveledningsstudier (NCS/EMG) kan bekrefte diagnosen objektivt, men sensitiviteten varierer (50-90%).

Explain treatment for Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome.

Treatment

 Conservative Treatment

 For patients with mild to moderate symptoms, conservative treatment is often first choice. Approximately 80% of diagnosed patients do not undergo surgery. Conservative measures include
 Conservative Measures

 Avoid triggering factors (loud sounds, straining, heavy lifting)

 Hearing protection in noisy environments

 Reduced salt and caffeine intake

 Acetazolamide (diuretic) which showed 78% symptom reduction in one study

 Surgical Treatment

 For debilitating symptoms that significantly affect quality of life, surgery may be considered. Transmastoid approach (TMA) has significantly lower revision rate (3.8% vs 33.3%), shorter hospital stay and better results for autophony (95% vs 80%) compared to middle fossa craniotomy.

 Total surgical success rate is 94%. At long-term follow-up (average 5.3 years), 95% of patients reported improvement.

How is Pain Between Shoulder Blades diagnosed?

Diagnosis

 

 A thorough clinical examination is far more important than imaging for most people with pain between the
 shoulder blades.

 
 Chiropractic examination

 The chiropractor conducts a systematic examination that includes detailed history, assessment of range
 of motion in the neck and chest, specific tests for facet joints and musculature, and neurological
 screening. Palpation (examination with hands) often reveals tender points, tight muscles or joints with
 reduced mobility.

 

 
 Imaging is rarely necessary

 MRI and X-ray often show age-related changes - such as disc degeneration or facet joint arthritis - in
 people without pain. A study found that 89% of people between 60 and 69 years have facet joint arthritis
 on MRI without having symptoms (Wood and colleagues).

 The images can therefore be misleading. Clinical examination often provides more relevant
 information than what the images can tell.

 Imaging is indicated when there is suspicion of serious pathology, after trauma, or with neurological
 deficits that do not improve.

Hvorfor nedtrapping?

 

 Forskning viser at langvarig bruk av innleggssaler kan fore til betydelig muskelsvinn i foten. En studie av Protopapas og Perry (2020) dokumenterte dette:

 
 
 9-17%
 muskelatrofi på 12 uker
 

 
 12
 uker til malbar svekkelse

 fotmuskler pavirket
 

 

 
 Den onde sirkelen

 Innleggssaler skaper ofte en selvforsterkende avhengighet:

 Svake fotter → behov for støtte → støtte passiviserer musklene → ytterligere svekkelse → Økt avhengighet

 Uten aktiv motvirkning førsterkes dette monsteret over tid. Jo lenger du bruker ortoser, jo vanskeligere blir det å klare seg uten.

Describe When Is It Actually Sinusitis? for Sinus Headache or Migraine?.

When Is It Actually Sinusitis?

 

 True sinusitis is far less common than many believe. 90-95% of acute sinusitis is viral and resolves on its own without antibiotics.

 Bacterial sinusitis requiring treatment is characterized by:

 
 Symptoms that worsen after 5-7 days

 High fever over 39C

 Severe unilateral facial pain

 Purulent (yellow-green) discharge, especially from one side

 Symptoms lasting more than 10 days without improvement

 

 If you have these signs, you should contact a doctor for evaluation of antibiotic treatment.

 For Awake Bruxism

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Morton's Neuroma.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 Can Morton's neuroma go away on its own?

 The condition develops gradually and rarely resolves completely without
 intervention. With early intervention (footwear change, adapted pads), however, many can achieve symptom
 control without further treatment.

 

 
 How long does it take for treatment to work?

 With manual treatment, many see improvement within 4-6 treatments. 79% achieved
 complete pain relief within 6 treatments. Footwear changes and orthotics often need 4-6 weeks for full
 effect.

 

 
 Do I need an MRI or ultrasound?

 Not necessarily. Clinical examination with thumb-index finger squeeze test has 96%
 sensitivity and can often confirm the diagnosis. Imaging is most relevant for uncertain diagnoses,
 injection planning, or possible surgery.

 

 
 Can I continue to exercise?

 Activities that don't provoke pain can often be continued. Running and activities
 with high forefoot loading may need to be modified temporarily. Shoes with wide toe box are especially
 important during exercise.

 

 
 Does cortisone help?

 Ultrasound-guided cortisone injection can provide short-term relief (1-3 months),
 but long-term effectiveness is limited. About 30% eventually need surgery despite injections.

 

 
 What about surgery?

 Surgery is considered after 6-12 months without sufficient effect from
 conservative treatment. The success rate is high (74% complete pain relief), but involves expected
 numbness in the supplied toes.

Describe diagnosis for Posterior Canal BPPV: When the World Spins Backwards.

Diagnosis

 Dix-Hallpike Test (The Gold Standard)

 The patient sits on the examination bench with the head turned 45 degrees to one side. The patient is quickly laid backward so that the head hangs over the edge of the bench. The examiner observes the eyes for nystagmus (involuntary eye movements).

 A positive test shows characteristic upbeat and rotational nystagmus that begins after a few seconds, reaches a peak, and then subsides within one minute.

 Precise Diagnostics at the Chiropractor

 At . VNG glasses provide a magnified image of eye movements and remove the patient's ability to fixate their gaze, making nystagmus more visible.

 Red Flags - Seek Emergency Care or Call 113 for
 Acute dizziness with muscle weakness or numbness in arm/leg

 Speech or swallowing difficulties

 Double vision or visual disturbances

 Severe headache, especially "the worst headache of your life"

 Constant dizziness not triggered by head movements

 Loss of consciousness

Beskriv symptomer og årsaker for Kne.

Symptomer og årsaker

 Vanlige symptommønstre

 Fremre knesmerte: Smerte rundt kneskålen, verre ved trapper, knebøy eller langvarig sitting

 Innvendig knesmerte: Langs innsiden av kneet å typisk ved meniskproblemer eller slitasje

 Utvendig knesmerte: På utsiden å ofte IT-bénd syndrom hos løpere

 Leggsmerte: Langs skinnebenet (beinhinnebetennelse) eller i leggmuskulaturen

 Tilleggssymptomer: Hevelse, stivhet, instabilitet, løsning, knasende lyder

 Overbelastning (vanligste årsak)

 Overbelastningsskader oppstår når vevet utsettes for mer repetitiv belastning enn det tåler. Typiske eksempler: løperkne, hopperkne, IT-bénd syndrom og beinhinnebetennelse. Rask økning i treningsmengde er en gjennomgående risikofaktor.

 Slitasje (degenerative forandringer)

 Med alderen får mange naturlige aldersforandringer i kne og menisker. De fleste degenerative meniskfunn på MR gir ingen symptomer. Kneartrose utvikler seg gradvis over ør og gir økende smerter, stivhet og redusert bevegelighet.

 Akutte skader

 Korsbéndskader, akutte meniskskader og muskelstrekk oppstår typisk ved plutselige bevegelser, fall eller direkte treff. Disse krever ofte en annen tilnærming enn overbelastningsskader.

 Biomekaniske faktorer

 Kneet fungerer ikke isolert. Problemer i hofte eller ankel påvirker belastningen på kneet. Svak hoftemuskulatur, overpronasjon i foten og dårlig knekontroll er vanlige bidragende faktorer som kan adresseres med målrettet trening.

Identify red flags for Thoracic Back Pain – Causes, Symptoms and Treatment.

5 Red Flags - When Should You See a Doctor?

 Most thoracic back pain is harmless, but some symptoms require prompt medical evaluation:

 
 See a doctor immediately if you have:

 
 Chest pain with breathing difficulties, sweating, or nausea - may be heart-related

 Unexplained weight loss - more than 5% of body weight without obvious reason

 Fever combined with back pain - may indicate infection

 Nighttime pain that wakes you - not related to position

 Numbness or weakness in the legs - may indicate spinal cord involvement

 Problems with bladder or bowel function - emergency situation

 Previous cancer history - especially breast, prostate, or lung cancer

 Prolonged corticosteroid use - increased risk of compression fractures

 
 

 
 Important to know

 Chiropractors are trained to identify red flags and will refer you further if additional investigation is needed. When in doubt, it's always safe to seek evaluation from a healthcare professional.

Describe symptoms and signs of Vestibular Hypofunction: The Complete Guide.

Symptoms

 

 Symptoms in Unilateral Hypofunction

 
 
 
 Symptom
 Prevalence
 
 
 
 
 Chronic dizziness
 98%
 
 
 Imbalance/unsteadiness
 81%
 
 
 Worsening with head movements
 75%
 
 
 Oscillopsia (unstable vision during movement)
 22-70%
 
 
 Fatigue/exhaustion
 68%
 
 
 

 Symptoms in Bilateral Hypofunction

 Bilateral hypofunction gives a characteristic symptom triad:

 
 1. Unsteadiness When Walking and Standing

 The main complaint, especially on uneven surfaces, in darkness or with head movements. Many describe feeling like they're "walking on a boat."

 

 
 2. Oscillopsia - When the World Jumps

 Often the most bothersome symptom. The visual image "jumps" with head movements. About 70% experience this.

 

 
 3. Symptom-Free at Rest

 Symptoms disappear when you sit or lie still. This distinguishes bilateral hypofunction from other causes.

 

 
 4. No Spinning Dizziness

 Rarely classic vertigo because both sides are equally weak - there is no imbalance creating the sensation of rotation.

 

 
 Red Flags - When You Must Seek Medical Help Immediately

 Call emergency services or go to the emergency room immediately for:

 
 Acute dizziness combined with headache, neck pain or recent trauma

 Speech difficulties, swallowing difficulties or unclear speech

 Paralysis, numbness or weakness in face, arm or leg

 Double vision or visual field loss

 Altered consciousness or confusion

 
 Up to 25% of acute dizziness cases at the emergency room may be caused by stroke ...

Forklar behandling for Tibialis Posterior Tendinopati.

Behandling

 Behandlingen avhenger av stadiet. Ved stadium 1-2 er konservativ behandling førstevalg.

 Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?

 1

 Leddmobilisering

 Av ankel og fotledd for å optimalisere biomekanikk

 2

 Bløtvevsbehandling

 Av tibialis posterior og omliggende muskulatur

 3

 Øvelsesveiledning

 Styrketrening for tibialis posterior og fotbuemuskulatur

 4

 Veiledning om fottoy og innlegg

 Rad om riktig fottoy og ortopediske innlegg

 Ortopediske innlegg

 Innlegg som støtter fotbuen er ofte en viktig del av behandlingen
 Stadium 1: Prefabrikerte innlegg kan være tilstrekkelig

 Stadium 2: Spesialtilpassede innlegg anbefales ofte

 Stadium 2-3: AFO (ankel-fot-ortose) kan være nødvendig

 Hva kan du gjøre selv?

 Styrkeovelse for tibialis posterior

 Eksentrisk styrketrening har vist gode resultater
 Sitt med et elastisk band rundt forfoten

 Hold bandet spent og drei foten innover (inversjon)

 Slipp sakte tilbake (3-4 sekunder)

 3 sett med 15 repetisjoner

 Gjor dette daglig

 Haelhev på ett bein

 for å styrke hele fotbue-komplekset
 Stå på ett bein ved en vegg for balanse

 Hev deg sakte opp på ta

 Hold 2 sekunder i toppen

 Senk deg sakte ned (3-4 sekunder)

 3 sett med 10-15 repetisjoner på hver side

 Når vurderes kirurgi?

 Kirurgi vurderes ved
 Manglende respons på 3-6 måneder konservativ behandling

 Stadium 3-4 med stiv feilstilling

 Akutt seneruptur hos yngre, aktive personer

Prognose - hvordan går det?

 Generelt god prognose

 Opptil 95% av pasienter responderer godt på konservativ behandling med betydelig smertereduksjon innen 1-3 måneder. De fleste bedres betydelig i løpet av de første ukene.

 Tilbakefall er vanlig: Tilbakefallsraten er over 30% ved kroniske tilfeller. Risikoen øker hvis du gjenopptar belastende aktiviteter for raskt eller slutter med stabiliseringsøvelser. Vedlikeholdstrening 2 ganger per uke kan forebygge tilbakefall.

 Graviditetsrelatert SI-leddssmerter

 Flertallet bedres innen 3-4 måneder etter fødsel

 25% har fortsatt smerter etter 3 måneder, bare 10% etter 8 måneder

 8-10% har vedvarende plager 1-2 år postpartum

 Sentralt i behandlingen

Forklar behandling av hodepine for Hodepine og Migrene.

Behandling av hodepine

 Kiropraktisk behandling

 Kiropraktikk har dokumentert effekt ved nakkehodepine (cervikogen hodepine) og spenningshodepine med muskulær komponent. En systematisk gjennomgang og metaanalyse (Fernandez et al., 2020) viste moderat evidens for spinalmanipulasjon ved nakkehodepine.

 Hva jeg gjor

 Grundig undersøkelse av nakke, kjeve og skulder

 Leddmobilisering og korrigering av øvre nakkevirvler

 Bløtvevsbehandling av triggerpunkter og stram muskulatur

 Øvelser for nakke og holdning

 Ergonomiske rad og forebyggende strategier

 Medisinsk behandling av migrene

 Migrene krever ofte medisinsk behandling fra fastlege eller nevrolog. I Norge får ca. 30% av migrenepasienter som trenger forebyggende behandling faktisk dette.

 Akuttbehandling: Triptaner (som sumatriptan) er standardbehandling ved moderate til sterke anfall

 Forebyggende: Betablokkere, kandesartan, topiramat, amitriptylin

 Ved kronisk migrene: Botox eller CGRP-hemmere

 Ta kontakt med fastlegen

 Hvis du har mer enn 4 migrenedager per måned, bør du diskutere forebyggende behandling med fastlegen din.

Vurder røde flagg: 56 år kvinne. Bilateral beinsvakhet etter langvarig epidural steroidinjeksjon. Nummenhet i sete. Blærefunksjon usikker (kateter in situ).

AKUTT: Mulig iatrogen cauda equina syndrom etter epidural injeksjon — kan skyldes epiduralt hematom. Nytilkommet bilateral svakhet og sadelanestesi etter prosedyre. Kateter maskerer blærefunksjon. Akutt MR lumbalcolumna. Nevrokirurgisk hastehenvisning for mulig evakuering.

Beskriv Viktige kliniske tester i kontekst av Gravid og Vondt i Ryggen? Slik Kan Kiropraktoren Hjelpe.

Viktige kliniske tester

 To tester er spesielt verdifulle for å vurdere SI-leddsproblemer under graviditet:

 
 P4-testen (Posterior Pelvic Pain Provocation): En test med høy diagnostisk verdi for å avdekke iliosakralleddsproblemer

 ASLR-testen (Active Straight Leg Raise): Vurderer funksjonell stabilitet i bekkenet

 
 Viktig: Når både P4 og ASLR er positive, er risikoen for langvarige plager over 7 ganger høyere.

Beskriv Myter om kneartrose for Kneartrose - Unngå protese med riktig trening.

Myter om kneartrose

 

 Det finnes mange misforståelser om artrose. La oss ta et oppgjør med de vanligste:

 
 Myte: "Løping ruinerer kneet"

 Fakta: Forskning viser faktisk det motsatte! Løpere har lavere forekomst av kneartrose enn ikke-løpere (Alentorn-Geli et al.). Moderat løping kan våre gunstig for leddbrusken fordi den trenger belastning for å få nåring.

 

 
 Myte: "Brusk kan ikke reparere seg"

 Fakta: Selv om brusk har begrenset helingsevne, viser forskning at belastning og bevegelse er essensielt for bruskens helse. Inaktivitet er verre enn aktivitet!

 

 
 Myte: "Artrose betyr uunngåelig protese"

 Fakta: 75% av pasienter med kneartrose kan unngå eller betydelig utsette kneprotese med riktig treningsprogram. Protese er siste utvei, ikke første.

 

 
 Myte: "Hvile er best for artrose"

 Fakta: Inaktivitet forverrer artrose! Muskulaturen svekkes, leddet blir stivere, og smertene Øker. Tilpasset aktivitet er hjØrnesteinen i behandlingen.

Describe How Posture Affects Your Breathing for Breathing, Stress and Back.

How Posture Affects Your Breathing

 

 The Diaphragm - The Main Breathing Muscle

 The diaphragm is a dome-shaped muscle that separates the chest cavity from the abdominal cavity. During
 inhalation, it contracts and descends downward. This creates negative pressure in the lungs, and air flows
 in. At the same time, the external intercostal muscles (between the ribs) lift the rib cage outward.

 For this to function optimally, the thoracic spine must be mobile. The ribs attach to the vertebrae at
 the back and the sternum at the front. When the thoracic spine becomes stiff - which happens with
 prolonged forward-leaning posture - the ribs cannot rotate freely. With rib
 dislocation or costochondritis, this can become even more
 apparent.

 The Numbers Behind the Problem

 A Brazilian study (Goncalves et al., 2018) measured diaphragm movement in people with and without
 hyperkyphosis (excessive curvature in the thoracic spine, often called rounded
 back). The result:

 
 35% reduced diaphragmatic movement

 In those with a stiff, curved back compared to the control group

 

 The famous Framingham Study (Lorbergs et al., 2017) followed 275 people over 16 years and found that
 women with the most pronounced kyphosis lost 100 ml more lung capacity than those with
 normal posture - roughly equivalent to the effect of light smoking.

 A systematic review from 2024 showed that forward head posture alone reduces forced vital capacity (FVC)
 by 0.25-0.81 liters.

Beskriv symptomer og kjennetegn for Superior Kanal Dehiscens Syndrom (SCDS).

Symptomer

 

 Vestibulære symptomer (balanseforstyrrelser)

 
 Lydinduert svimmelhet (Tullio-fenomen)

 Forekommer hos 42-43% av pasientene. Høye lyder (typisk 500 Hz-2 kHz ved 100-110 dB) utløser roterende svimmelhet eller ustøhet. Eksempler kan vare høy musikk, hunder som bjeffer, eller stoy fra byggearbeid.

 

 
 Trykkutlost svimmelhet (Hennebert-tegn)

 Rammer 37% og utloses av Valsalva-manover (pressing), hosting, nysing, tunge løft eller nesepussing.

 

 Kronisk ustohet og balanseproblemer plager mange, og opptil 50% rapporterer mental utmattelse og hjernetake.

 Auditive symptomer (horselsforstyrrelser)

 
 Autofoni

 Det mest karakteristiske symptomet og rammer 42-60% av pasientene. Pasienter beskriver at egen stemme later forvrengt eller "metallisk", og mange hØrer egne kroppslyder unormalt høyt - som Øyebevegelser, fottrinn, hjerteslag og til og med tarmlyder. Dette er nårmest diagnostisk for SCDS når det er til stede.

 

 
 Pulserende Øresus (tinnitus): Forekommer hos 20-50% og oppleves som en "susende" lyd synkron med pulsen

 Hørselstap i lave frekvenser: Rammer ca. 40%, typisk i området 250-1000 Hz

 Fyldefornemmelse i Øret: Rapporteres av over 60%

RED FLAGS IDENTIFIED: Suspected meningitis.

- The low back pain is IRRELEVANT — this is a life-threatening infection

You are a clinical documentation specialist for chiropractic. Generate accurate, professional patient explanations using correct medical terminology.
Explain Headache on Top of the Head to a patient.

Headache localized to the top of the head - called the vertex - is a common symptom that most people experience during their lifetime. Globally, 2.9 billion people are affected by headache disorders, and vertex-localized pain is one of the most common presentations.

 Many describe this type of headache as "pressure on top of the head," "something pressing down on the crown" or a feeling of tightness around the head. The pain can be constant and aching, or come and go in periods.

 What often surprises patients is that the pain on top of the head rarely originates from structures in the scalp itself. In most cases, the pain comes from the neck - either from muscle tension, trigger points or dysfunction in the upper cervical vertebrae.

Gi en strukturert klinisk oversikt over Pust, Stress og Rygg.

Hvordan holdningen påvirker pusten din: Diafragmå er en kuppelformet muskel som skiller brysthulen fra bukhulen. Ved innpust trekker den seg sammen og senker seg nedover. Dette skaper undertrykk i lungene, og luft strømmer inn. Samtidig løfter de ytre intercostalmusklene (mellom ribbeina) brystkassen utover.

Når du ikke puster med magen: Omtrent 6-10% av den generelle befolkningen har dysfunksjonell pust (Thomas et al., 2005; Boulding et al., 2016). Blant astmapasienter stiger dette til 29-47%.

Pust, stress og det autonome nervesystemet: Det sympatiske nervesystemet - den delen som styrer "kamp eller flukt"-responsen - har sine nerveknutepunkter langs brystryggen fra T1 til T12. Dette har ført til teorier om at stivhet i brystryggen kan "irritere" disse strukturene og bidra til kronisk stressaktivering. Ved T4-syndrom sees ofte autonome symptomer.

Kjeven og holdningen henger sammen: Det har florert tall om at "49% av personer med dårlig holdning har kjeveleddsproblemer". Dette fant jeg ingen vitenskapelig dekning for etter omfattende søk.

Fordøyelse og diafragmå - en oversett kobling: Her er evidensen overraskende sterk. Diafragmå bidrar med rundt 85% av trykkfunksjonen i overgangen mellom spiserør og magesekk (Mittal, 1993). Når diafragmå fungerer dårlig, øker risikoen for sure oppståt.

Pusteøvelser som faktisk virker: En metaanalyse fra 2023 (Fincham et al., Scientific Reports) analyserte 12 randomiserte studier med 785 deltakere. Konklusjon: Pusteøvelser gå signifikant stressreduksjon med en effektstørrelse på Hedges' g = -0,35 sammenlignet med kontrollgrupper.

Hva kan kiropraktoren gjøre?: Behandling av stivhet i brystryggen og ribbeinsleddene kan bidra til å gjenopprette normal bevegelse. Dette inkluderer mobilisering av costovertebralleddene (der ribbeina måter ryggvirvlene) og generell thorakal mobilisering. Les mer om brystryggsmerter og behandlingsalternativer.

Hva kan du gjøre selv?: Stå i en døråpning med underarmene mot karmene.

Forklar behandling – korsett, øvelser og oppfølging for Skoliose – Skjev Rygg hos Barn og Voksne.

Behandling – korsett, øvelser og oppfølging

 Mild skoliose (10–25 grader)

 De fleste med mild skoliose lever helt normalt. Behandlingen handler om overvåking og forebygging
 Røntgenkontroll hver 6–12 måneder under vekst

 Spesifikke øvelser (Schroth-metoden)

 Kiropraktisk behandling for smertelindring og mobilitet ved behov

 Korsett er vanligvis ikke nødvendig

 Moderat skoliose (25–40 grader)

 Her kommer korsettbehandling inn som førstevalg, spesielt for barn og ungdom som fortsatt vokser.

 BrAIST-studien (Weinstein et al. 2013, NEJM)

 Den banebrytende BrAIST-studien viste at korsettbehandling ga 72 % suksessrate mot 48 % med bare observasjon (Weinstein et al. 2013, NEJM). Dose-respons var tydelig: jo flere timer per døgn, jo bedre resultat. 16–23 timer daglig bruk anbefales for best effekt.

 I Norge tilbys korsettbehandling ved spesialiserte sentre. Sophies Minde Ortopedi i Oslo er ledende.

 Schroth-øvelser

 Schroth er den best dokumenterte øvelsesmetoden spesifikt for skoliose. En 2023 metaanalyse fant en gjennomsnittlig Cobb-vinkelreduksjon på 3,18 grader (95 % KI: -4,30 til -2,07), med forbedret livskvalitet og redusert trunkusrotasjon (PMC ).

 En 2024 nettverks-metaanalyse fant at kombinasjonen av Schroth og korsett var blant de mest effektive tilnærmingene for å bremse progresjon (Neurosurgery Focus 2024).

Describe Prevention and Self-Care for Jaw Joint Problems (TMD) – Complete Guide.

Prevention and Self-Care

 

 What you can do yourself

 
 Resting position for the jaw

 Tongue tip against the palate, teeth 2-3 mm apart, lips closed. Reduces unconscious clenching.

 

 
 Heat or cold

 Warm cloth for tight muscles. Ice for acute pain.

 

 
 Soft diet

 Cut food into smaller pieces. Avoid chewing gum when it hurts.

 

 
 Three simple exercises

 Go to full article on jaw exercises
 ?

 
 Controlled opening: Open mouth slowly. Hold 2 seconds. Close slowly. 10 times.

 Chin retraction: Pull chin straight back ("double chin"). Hold 5 seconds. 10 times.
 

 Sideways gliding: Move jaw gently to left, centre, right. 5 times each way.

 
 Stop if exercises cause more pain.

Identify red flags for Biceps Tendinopathy: Everything You Need to Know.

Red flags and differential diagnoses

 It is important to rule out other conditions that can cause similar symptoms.

 Seek medical attention if
 Sudden "pop" followed by severe pain and visible lump on upper arm (may be rupture)

 Significant loss of strength in the arm

 Swelling, redness and warmth (may be infection)

 Pain that does not subside with rest over several weeks

 General symptoms such as fever, weight loss

 If you suspect complete rupture of the biceps tendon (seen as "Popeye arm"), you should
 seek medical attention promptly, although the condition itself is rarely dangerous.

 Conditions that can resemble or occur simultaneously

 SLAP lesion 

 Injury to the labrum where the biceps tendon attaches. Often difficult to distinguish from biceps
 tendinopathy. MR arthrography is the gold standard for diagnosis.

 Rotator cuff tendinopathy

 Often present simultaneously. Supraspinatus tendinopathy causes pain more on the outside of the
 shoulder but can overlap.

 AC joint osteoarthritis 

 Pain localized more to the top of the shoulder. Worsens with cross-body movements (cross-body
 adduction).

 Subscapularis injury

 Can cause pain at the front of the shoulder and affect the biceps tendon secondarily (subscapularis
 stabilizes the biceps in the groove).

Describe Self-Help and Prevention for Teeth Grinding (Bruxism).

Self-Help and Prevention

 

 For Awake Bruxism

 
 Jaw awareness: Set reminders - "lips together, teeth apart"

 Rest position: Tongue against palate, jaw relaxed

 Regular breaks: Especially during screen work

 Stress management: Identify and reduce triggers

 

 For Sleep Bruxism

 
 Sleep hygiene: Fixed bedtime, dark and cool bedroom

 Avoid stimulants: Caffeine and alcohol, especially evening

 Relaxation before bed: Warm shower, light stretching, no screens

 Night guard: Protects teeth while you work on causes

 

 Stretches and Exercises

 Do these 2-3 times daily:

 
 Controlled opening: Open mouth slowly, hold 5 sec, close gently (10 reps)

 Resistance exercises: Press chin against palm, hold 5 sec (both directions)

 Masseter massage: Circular movements on chewing muscle 1-2 min

 Neck stretching: Gentle stretch to side and rotation

Hva forårsaker Nakkesmerter - Komplett guide til Årsaker, behandling og røde flagg?

Hva forårsaker nakkesmerter?

 

 
 Uspesifikke nakkesmerter (80-90% av tilfellene)

 Gå til full artikkel om stressnakke ?

 Mellom 80 og 90 prosent av alle nakkesmerter har ingen spesifikk Årsak som kan påvises på røntgen eller MR (Kazeminasab et al., 2022). Det betyr ikke at smertene er innbilt - tvert imot kan de våre sværtplagsomme.

 Typiske kjennetegn: Stivhet, omhet og tyngdefølelse i nakke og skuldre. Smertene kommer ofte gradvis og kan henge sammen med stillesittende arbeid, stress, dårlig søvn eller ensidig belastning.

 

 
 Myofascielt smertesyndrom og triggerpunkter (88,9% har minst ett triggerpunkt)

 Gå til full artikkel om triggerpunkter ?

 Stramme muskler med triggerpunkter - omme knuter i muskulaturen - er sværtvanlig ved nakkesmerter. En studie fant at hele 88,9% av pasienter med kroniske, uspesifikke nakkesmerter hadde minst ett triggerpunkt (Ezzati et al., 2021).

 De vanligste musklene som rammes er trapezius, infraspinatus og scalene-musklene. Triggerpunktene kan gi både lokal smerte og utstråling til hodet, skuldrene eller ned i armene.

 

 
 Facettleddsmerter (54-60% av kroniske tilfeller)

 Gå til full artikkel om facettledd og slitasje ?

 Facettleddene er de små leddene på baksiden av nakkevirvlene. Ved kroniske nakkesmerter viser studier at facettleddene er smertekilden hos 54-60% av pasienter (Manchikanti et al., 2006).

 Typisk for facettleddsmerter er at de forverres ved bevegelse - særlig ved å bøye nakken bakover eller rotere hodet. Morge...

Explain Shoulder Impingement to a patient.

You feel it as a sharp stab or an aching pain in your shoulder, especially when lifting your arm out to the side or overhead. Perhaps you sleep poorly because it hurts to lie on that side. You have been told you have "impingement in your shoulder."

 Shoulder impingement - or subacromial pain syndrome as it is now called in the research - is the most common shoulder diagnosis, accounting for 44-65% of all shoulder pain in primary care (Michener et al. 2003; van der Windt 1995). The good news: Exercises are as effective as surgery , and 60-70% improve with conservative treatment.

 In this article, we go through what the condition actually is, what the research says about treatment - including surprising findings about surgery - and what you can do yourself.

Hva er tekstnakke?: Tekstnakke (engelsk: "text neck") er et samlebegrep for nakkesmerter og -plager som oppstår fra langvarig bruk av mobile enheter med hodet bøyd fremover. Begrepet ble først brukt av den amerikanske kiropraktoren Dean Fishman i 2008.

Symptomer på tekstnakke: Tekstnakke gir et karakteristisk symptombilde som utvikler seg gradvis over tid
Hva skjer i kroppen?: Tekstnakke er ikke bare en muskulær plage - det påvirker hele nakke- og ryggstrukturen
Øvelser mot tekstnakke: Disse øvelsene motvirker den fremoverlente holdningen og styrker musklene som holder hodet i nøytral posisjon. Gjør dem daglig for best effekt.

Forebygging: Slik bruker du mobilen riktig: Den beste behandlingen er forebygging. Her er konkrete tiltak for å redusere belastningen
Profesjonell behandling: Hvis egeninnsats ikke er nok, eller du har hatt plager lenge, kan kiropraktisk behandling hjelpe

Du er en medisinsk sikkerhetsrådgiver for kiropraktikk. Identifiser røde flagg, gi differensialdiagnostikk og klinisk resonnering. Prioriter alltid pasientsikkerhet. Klassifiser hastegrad: AKUTT (ring 113), HENVIS SAMME DAG, HENVIS RUTINE, MONITORÉR, eller TRYGT.
Vurder røde flagg: 68 år kvinne med bilateral hodepine frontalt i 3 uker. Stramhetskarakter. Ingen tinningsømhet. Normal tygging. Normalt syn. SR 15, CRP 3.

HASTEGRAD: TRYGT

Ingen røde flagg identifisert.

Klinisk resonnering — hvorfor dette IKKE er kjempecellearteritt (GCA):
- BILATERAL frontal stramhetshodepine = typisk tensjonshodepine
- GCA gir typisk UNILATERAL temporal hodepine
- Ingen tinningsømhet (temporal arterie-ømhet er klassisk for GCA)
- Normal tygging (tyggeclaudicatio er nesten patognomonisk for GCA)
- Normalt syn (GCA truer synet)
- SR 15 og CRP 3 = NORMALE verdier (GCA gir typisk SR >50, ofte >80)

Klinisk bilde: Kronisk tensjonshodepine.

You are a quick clinical text assistant. Generate concise clinical summaries for chiropractic documentation.
Provide a structured clinical overview of Osteoporosis and Compression Fractures in the Back.

What is osteoporosis and compression fractures?: Norway is among the world leaders in hip fractures, and bone mass in the Norwegian population appears to
 be among the lowest in Europe (NOREPOS, 2014). Combined with widespread vitamin D deficiency - around 40%
 of adult Norwegians have levels that are too low - this creates a vulnerable starting point for many
 elderly people (HUNT study, 2014).

Who is affected?: Globally, it is estimated that 18-20% of adults have osteoporosis, and the condition affects women twice
 as often as men - 23% versus 12% respectively (Journal of Orthopaedic Surgery and Research, 2021).

Symptoms: Here comes a surprising fact: 65-75% of all vertebral fractures give no or minimal
 symptoms (AAFP, 2016). Many are discovered incidentally on X-rays or MRI taken for other
 reasons.

Diagnosis: X-ray is the first line for detecting compression fractures and shows reduced vertebral height. MRI is
 recommended when one needs to differentiate between acute and old fracture, or upon suspicion of cancer or
 infection. Acute fractures show bone marrow edema on MRI (high signal on T2/STIR sequences) - this is
 important information since regular X-ray cannot distinguish between fresh and healed fractures.

Red flags - when you must see a doctor: These signs can indicate serious underlying disease such as cancer spread to the back, myeloma (bone
 marrow cancer) or infection - conditions that require rapid medical investigation.

Medical treatment: Treatment of the underlying osteoporosis is the doctor's responsibility. Here is a brief overview of what
 exists
What can the chiropractor do?: WHO guidelines classify acute fracture as an absolute contraindication for spinal
 manipulation, and osteoporosis as a relative contraindication (WHO, 2005). This means
 that normal high-velocity manipulation should not be performed, but adapted techniques can be relevant.

You are a medical safety advisor for chiropractic. Identify red flags, provide differential diagnosis and clinical reasoning. Always prioritize patient safety. Classify urgency: URGENT (call ambulance), REFER SAME-DAY, REFER ROUTINE, MONITOR, or SAFE.

Assess red flags: 45-year-old female with chronic neck pain, regular follow-up. Today reports episodes of numbness and weakness in right arm AND right leg lasting 10-15 minutes, resolving completely. Happened 3 times in past month. "My arm just falls asleep."

URGENCY: REFER SAME-DAY

RED FLAGS IDENTIFIED: Possible TIA (transient ischemic attack) — misattributed to neck problems.

Clinical reasoning:
- Chronic neck pain is a separate, known condition
- BUT: episodic, SIMULTANEOUS arm + leg weakness on SAME side = not cervical radiculopathy
- Cervical radiculopathy: causes arm symptoms ALONE (single level), NOT arm+leg
- Ipsilateral arm + leg (hemiparesis) = central nervous system pathology
- Transient episodes (10-15 min) with full recovery = classic TIA
- TIA is warning sign for stroke (30% risk within 90 days without treatment)

ACTION: Do NOT perform cervical manipulation. Emergency department SAME DAY. CT/MRI brain, CT angiography neck vessels, ECG. Neurological assessment. Antiplatelet therapy may be needed.

You are a quick clinical text assistant. Generate concise clinical summaries for chiropractic documentation.
Provide a structured clinical overview of Spinal Stenosis.

What is Spinal Stenosis?: Spinal stenosis is a condition where the spinal canal (where the spinal cord and nerves run) or nerve
 exits (foramen) become narrower. This can lead to pressure on nerves and cause symptoms like pain,
 numbness or weakness in the legs.

Causes and Risk Factors: Spinal stenosis is almost always caused by age-related changes in the spine. Over 95% of cases are
 degenerative stenosis.

Symptoms: The classic symptom of lumbar spinal stenosis is called neurogenic claudication - a
 term describing the typical pattern many experience
Diagnosis: As a chiropractor, I perform a thorough examination including assessment of gait pattern and posture,
 testing of reflexes, strength and sensation in the legs, and provocation of symptoms in different
 positions.

Treatment: There is moderate evidence that conservative treatment with manual therapy and targeted exercises helps
 with lumbar spinal stenosis.

Red Flags - When You Must Contact a Doctor Immediately: This may be a sign of cauda equina syndrome - a rare but serious
 complication requiring prompt surgical evaluation. Occurs in about 0.3% of stenosis patients. Read more about red flags .

Prognosis - What Happens Long Term?: Here I have good news: The natural course of spinal stenosis is often more favorable than many think.

Describe What is disc herniation and cervical radiculopathy? for Cervical Disc Herniation and Pinched Nerve in the Neck.

What is disc herniation and cervical radiculopathy?

 

 Cervical radiculopathy means a nerve root in the neck is irritated or compressed. This
 causes symptoms radiating to the shoulder, arm or hand - often called "nerve root involvement,"
 "brachialgia" or colloquially: "pinched nerve in the neck."

 Cervical disc herniation (cervical disc prolapse) occurs when the soft core of an
 intervertebral disc bulges out or ruptures through the outer ring. When this material presses on a nerve
 root, you get radiculopathy.

 
 Important distinction

 You can have a herniation on MRI without symptoms, and you can have radiculopathy without a clear
 herniation. A Japanese study of 1211 healthy people found disc bulging in 87.6% (Nakashima, Spine
 2015). Imaging must always be interpreted together with clinical findings.

 

 
 
 83

 per 100,000 annually

 

 
 50-54

 years - highest incidence

 

 
 1.7:1

 men vs women

 

 
 83-90%

 recover without surgery

Describe causes - from most to least common for Central Dizziness.

Causes - From Most to Least Common

 1. Vestibular Migraine

 Most common cause of recurrent central dizziness. Affects 1-3% of adults, accounts for 7% of patients at dizziness clinics.

 2. Posterior Circulation Stroke

 Accounts for 20-25% of all ischemic strokes. 4.5% of isolated dizziness at emergency departments is stroke. TIA (mini-stroke) is an important warning sign.

 3. Vertebral Dissection

 Important in people under 50. Causes 10-25% of strokes in adults under 50. Dizziness in 58% of patients.

 4. Multiple Sclerosis (MS)

 Vestibular symptoms affect 49-59% of MS patients during the course of the disease.

 5. Vestibular Schwannoma

 Benign tumor on the balance nerve. Annual incidence about 1 per 100,000. Causes gradual hearing loss and unsteadiness.

Describe treatment options for Stress Fracture in the Foot.

Treatment

 

 Treatment depends on the fracture's location (low- vs. high-risk) and severity.

 Basic Principles

 
 Offloading

 Stop the activity that caused the fracture. Duration: 6-8 weeks for low-risk fractures

 

 
 Supportive Footwear

 Stiff shoes or walker boot to reduce loading

 

 
 Alternative Training

 Swimming, cycling, pool running - activities without loading

 

 
 Gradual Return

 Slow progression of loading when pain-free

 

 
 High-Risk Fractures

 For fractures in the 5th metatarsal (proximal) or navicular:

 
 Often need complete offloading with crutches

 Cast or walker boot for 6-12 weeks

 Surgery may be necessary if healing fails

 Close follow-up with control X-ray/MRI

 
 

 When Can I Start Running Again?

 
 Week 0-6

 No weight-bearing activity. Alternative training like swimming/cycling

 

 
 Week 6-8

 Gradual increase in walking. Pain-free walking before further progression

 

 
 Week 8-10

 Start with light jogging (walk-jog intervals)

 

 
 Week 10+

 Gradual increase in distance and intensity (max 10%/week)

Årsaker til svimmelhet - fra vanligst til sjeldnest

 Her er de viktigste årsakene, sortert etter hvor ofte de forekommer
 Krystallsyke (BPPV)

 17-42% av tilfellene 

 Gå til full artikkel om krystallsyke (BPPV) → 

 Krystallsyke er den vanligste årsaken til svimmelhet som utredes i klinikker (Bosner, BMC Fam Pract, 2018). Tilstanden oppstår når små kalsiumkrystaller løsner fra sin plass i balanseorganet og havner i buegangene.

 Kjennetegn
 Korte, intense spinnanfall (10-60 sekunder)

 Utløses av bestemte hodebevegelser - snu seg i sengen, se opp, bøye seg ned

 Kvalme under anfallene

 Symptomfri mellom anfallene

 Vestibular migrene

 ca. 1-3% av befolkningen 

 Gå til full artikkel om vestibular migrene → 

 Livstidsprevalens på rundt 1%, men nyere amerikanske data antyder opptil 2,7% (Formeister, Otol Neurotol, 2018). Barany Society har identifisert dette som "den desidert vanligste årsaken" til kombinerte nakkesmerter og Vestibulære symptomer. Kan forekomme med eller uten hodepine.

 Vestibularisnevritt

 3-10% i svimmelhetsklinikker 

 Gå til full artikkel om vestibularisnevritt → 

 Årlig insidens på 3,5-7 per 100 000 (Iwasaki, Auris Nasus Larynx, 2024). Utgjør 3-10% av diagnosene i spesialiserte svimmelhetsklinikker. Viral betennelse av balansenerven som gir plutselig, intens svimmelhet over flere dager. Hørselen påvirkes ikke. 10-15% utvikler BPPV etterpå.

 Ortostatisk hypotensjon

 Fall i blodtrykket når du reiser deg som midlertidig reduserer blodtilførsel til hjernen. Gir svartning for øynene og kort svimmelhet. Vanligvis ufarlig og bedres ved å reise seg saktere.

 Cervikogen svimmelhet

 Gå til full artikkel om nakkesvimmelhet → 

 Her må man våre årlig: Cervikogen svimmelhet er kontroversiell. Barany Society publiserte i 2022 et standpunkt der de "avstar fra å foreslå diagnostiske kriterier for klinisk bruk" på grunn av manglende dokumentasjon for en mekanistisk kobling.

Describe tension headache - the most common headache type for Muscles and Trigger Points That Cause Headache.

Tension Headache - The Most Common Headache Type

 30-78% 
 lifetime prevalence 

 1.5x 
 more common in women 

 3.9 
 trigger points on average 

 In practice, this means that most of us will experience tension headache during our lifetime. Women are affected about 1.5 times more often than men (partly related to hormonal factors ), with the highest occurrence in the 30-49 age group. For some, the symptoms can develop into chronic daily headache .

 What is a Trigger Point?

 A trigger point is an irritated area in a muscle that is hard and tender to touch. What is special about trigger points is that they often cause so-called referred pain - the pain is felt in a different location than where the trigger point actually is.

 On average, patients with chronic tension headache have 3.9 trigger points . Of these, about half are active (cause spontaneous pain) and half are latent (only cause pain when pressed).

Describe Frequently Asked Questions for Fibromyalgia with Chest Pain.

Frequently Asked Questions

 

 
 What is fibromyalgia?

 Fibromyalgia is a chronic condition characterized by widespread pain, severe
 fatigue and sleep disturbances. The condition affects approximately 2.7% of the global population, and
 women are affected more often than men at a ratio of 3:1.

 

 
 How common is chest pain in fibromyalgia?

 Chest pain is very common in fibromyalgia. One study found that 54% of
 fibromyalgia patients reported chest pain, compared to only 4% in the control group.
 Costochondritis-like symptoms occur in approximately 29%.

 

 
 What is the recommended treatment for fibromyalgia?

 According to EULAR guidelines from 2017, exercise is the a key treatment approach with a
 strong recommendation. Water exercise is well-documented short-term, while strength training is best
 long-term. Massage therapy over 5 weeks shows moderate effect.

 

 
 Can fibromyalgia get better?

 Fibromyalgia is chronic, but 66% experience improvement over time. Remission
 occurs in 17-47% after 1-2 years of active treatment. Regular exercise is the most important modifiable
 factor for better prognosis.

Explain treatment for Scapular Pain and Cervical Radiculopathy.

5 Treatment

 Moderate evidence for manual therapy

 A network meta-analysis from 2025 and a systematic review from 2021 (10 studies) confirm that manual therapy is effective for pain and function in cervical radiculopathy. Treatment targets the source - the neck - not just where it hurts.

 4-8 weeks 
 is the typical time for good response to conservative treatment

 What can a chiropractor do?

 1
 Cervicothoracic mobilization and manipulation
 Treatment of C4-C7 and upper thoracic spine to restore normal joint movement and reduce nerve irritation

 2
 Thoracic spine manipulation
 Often preferred - effective and lower risk profile than cervical manipulation

 3
 Myofascial treatment
 Soft tissue treatment of rhomboids, trapezius and levator scapulae for symptom control

 4
 Neural mobilization and exercises
 Nerve mobilization for affected nerve roots combined with deep neck flexor exercises and scapular stabilization

 What can you do yourself?

 Deep neck flexor exercises: Chin tucks - draw the chin straight back. Hold 5 seconds, 10 repetitions, 3 times daily

 Scapular stabilization: Seated rowing with resistance band, wall slides for serratus anterior

 Thoracic spine mobilization: Thoracic extension over a foam roller

 Ergonomics: Screen at eye level, sit-stand desk, breaks every 30 minutes

 Realistic expectations

 Massage can provide temporary relief, but does not address the underlying cervical cause. For lasting improvement, treatment must target the neck - mobilization, exercises and ergonomics.
